description:
Maru Sushi is located near the south west corner of Powell and Bush.  

It was sort of a late dinner since I had an early dinner or a late lunch earlier in the day.  While there are a variety of a la carte options I noticed that had a choose two combo for 22 bucks so I decided to go with that option because while I was sort of feeling for a hot dish I also felt like some sashimi as well so this combo was right up my alley.

I ended up going with the chicken katsu and sashimi (chef's choice) as well as a side order of salmon skin roll and a warm sake to start.  The combo also included a miso soup and small salad which is pretty standard with places serving bento boxes or some sort of set.  The sashimi came after both starters but the rest of the plates quickly came right after.  The chef's choice included 3 pieces of red tuna as well as 2 pieces of mackerel resting on shredded radish.  As for the katsu it was served with a side of rice and the salmon skin rolls are what I was expecting which was nice crunchy salmon skin in a nice, tight roll.

For a late dinner, I thought this was a good choice since I had a bit of variety with both hot, cold and a roll on the side and it was served up both quickly and the service was great.
author: Lambert P.

description:
This place is conveniently located with ok service. The best thing about it probably is its size so you don't have to wait long for a table. 

I was quickly seated at the bar and then no one came to me until the sushi chef asked a waitress to help me.

I ordered the 12 piece sashimi dinner which came with soup and salad. 

The soup and salad came up first. The miso soup was so thing, it really was disappointing. There is a place in Sacramento called Hana Tsubaki that makes real miso. The salad was good with fresh and crisp vegetables. 

The sashimi came next. I didn't like the cadence of the order. While I was eating the soup, and hadn't yet touched the salad, the sushi chef said "Here you go sir," and handed me my dish. He also didn't explain what was on the plate. 

I also didn't like the soy sauce. It is thin and strangely sweet.
author: Tran C.

description:
Just around the corner from us, we decided to check this place out since it had a good wide range of vegetarian sushi options to choose from. Maru Sushi also has a really wide price range, from about $5 for an inexpensive roll, going all the way up to $15 for some really good size ones.

For lunch, we ordered the Ume Shiso sushi (pickled plum) and Popeye sushi (sweet potato tempura with spinach and peanut sauce), along with a 3 piece combo plate with chicken teriyaki and ton katsu. 

Our food came out within a reasonable time. I was impressed with the size of the Popeye sushi, which made it well worth the cost (as it was on the higher end of the price range). My partner's combo plate had an impressive amount of food, so between the two of us, we wound up with more than enough to sate both of us. 

Overall the food was pretty decent, but I'd say the two sushi rolls I ordered were quite impressive. I was not disappointed at all in the flavours and taste, even though I was initially leery about the makeup of the Popeye roll. I was really glad I ordered it and barely added soy sauce or ginger while eating every piece. 

I look forward to trying several of the other vegetarian rolls they have available!
author: Cassandra J.

description: Delightful place for nice lunch before a play at the SF Playhouse. Bento box is a good value. Sushi is high quality!
author: David B.

description: Great sushi in Downtown, prices are a bit high but If you want good sushi this is a great place
author: Mario R.

description:
Food is good, but horrible experience.. 
I have been here in the past and the service I got last time was good, but not this time..

The servers were super busy which is totally understandable, but the server was very rude when we asked questions about the menu. Very unprofessional.

Will never be back..
author: Chul L.

description: I've been here a handful of times so far. I've been very pleased with the sushi rolls and appetizers. Great food! Nice staff! I would recommend this place to sushi lovers.
author: D R.

description:
Don't believe the prices on the app. Everything costs twice as much.
If you go there you lose your time.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Satisfied my craving for sushi while shopping at union square.  The restaurant is conveniently located 1 block away from union square / Apple store.  They were very accommodating to family with strollers as they were a nice sized restaurant, tables have ample spaces between them.  
 
The rolls were well proportioned, not too much rice and wrapped tightly so that it doesn't fall apart when you pick it up with chopsticks.  Fish was fresh.  My favorite roll was the yummy yummy roll.  It had tempura, crab and cream cheese.  It was creamy and delicious.  Service was excellent and attentive.  I would definitely come back next time I'm in the area.  

This place charges for ordering tea, but the tea is a better grade.  Finely grinded matcha  for $3.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Standard sushi/ Japanese shop. Good food by no means was it the best and the service was a bit frantic. I got the pick 2 set with salmon teriyaki and tempura. Both were good! I'd say portions could be bigger but nice place for a quick dinner or lunch. 

If back in SF, possibly would come back
author: Rachrelle R.

description: Dual fish roe, raw quail egg and Uni? No this is not a figure of your imagination, this is indeed the content of one of your next favorite dishes. I don't recall the exact name of this extravagance but it was something along the lines of 'Spoon of Love'. Point being order it before making any sudden moves. All other sushi consumed was satisfactory.
author: Christopher D.

description:
Nice place for sushi in downtown San Francisco. 
The restaurant has a good selection of rolls and nigiri. We tried several of their specialty rolls, and they were all good!
The service here was friendly and fast, and the prices are fair.
author: Håkon S.

description:
Very interesting spin on sushi! I got the Salmon Crunch Roll and I loved it. The outer coating of the sushi is actually fried and was sooo delicious. The addition of the green onion was perfect for the flavor of the roll. At first, I couldn't really make out the "salmon" part of the roll, it's very subtle. 

There was only one waitress when I went and she was super friendly! The place has a slight offish smell and is kinda dirty, but at least the food was good. (btw the bathroom smells really bad)
author: Jenni T.

description: Found this place near our hotel and the food was amazing. We got 3 different rolls and they were all all great. Highly recommend this place.
author: Ian S.

description: This place is overpriced for no special reason! We ordered the calamari that tasted & looked like it was previously frozen & just thrown in the fryer. Defitently not worth $12. My boyfriend ordered the teriyaki plate with the salmon which was ridiculously small for $20 & it was not fresh. My friends ordered the Lion King & Bay Roll but we couldn't tell the difference between the two. They both tasted the same! I had the red devil & added jalapeños for $1 but I don't regret it at all. It was very tasty & enjoyable. Out of the 5 dishes I remember us ordering, only 1 was good. It wasn't worth the price we paid considering we went to another restaurant to eat an hour later. -.- don't waste your money here!
author: Allyssa P.

description:
Not very satisfied with the experience here. Sure we are out of towners who don't want to walk far from our hotel but really thought we would hit it big with the sushi in this city.

First we walked to Sushi Toni which had better reviews but the inside was looking so rough we decided to try here instead. And sure, the atmosphere is good but the service and more importantly, the food had room for improvement.

We started with the jalapeño appetizer which was AMAZING! The gyoza which was kind of greasy/ soggy rather than crispy. I was so excited for nigiri and rolls and this was the part which was kind of a bummer. They gave me sushi when I specifically asked for nigiri. The fish was just slightly warmer than it should be, a health hazard. The salmon and tuna portions however were descent sizes. I also got the red devil, which for $15 I thought would be much better. The tuna was a shredded thing, why would you not just do pieces of fish? And had off textures in the roll.

Once we got our food we did not see our server again, had to get up and ask someone for our bill.

When we got back to the hotel my friend got sick. If you are looking for good sushi and service, go somewhere else.
author: Sasha T.

description: Came here with a friend for dinner. Got the charashi bowl and it was a huge mistake. It was basically a poke bowl... only two kinds of fish cut up in cubes and they definitely skimp out on the fish. The service wasn't very great either. Overall, pretty disappointed and won't be coming back.
author: Melody S.

description: Oh how I love this place! The flavors are so wonderful and everything is fresh! My favorite is the Labamba roll. I go out of my way to come here when I'm in SF. Thank you, Kamui, Buddha and Jeanette for a great pre-race dinner!
author: Susan C.

description: I wish it could be done better even it's for tourist.
author: Faye L.

description: Delicious food and awesome service!! Stop by here if you're in the area, food is great quality and sushi is probably your best bet here. I ordered the crunchy salmon roll and it did not disappoint
author: Tiffany S.

description:
The chef and the staff made a beautiful sushi platter in just 15 min notice for us to celebrate our office manager's birthday. 
The sushi and sashimi was to die for. Fresh, delicious and the portions were very generous. Thank you so much from Union Square Dental Practice. You are the best!
author: Maya M.

description:
In short: eat here if you like paying more than you should be.

We had dinner here while visiting SF from Seattle - where we have been able to learn a good bit about what good vs subpar vs cheap sushi is, and how much it should cost. 

The food here is mediocre - it's fine, definitely not mind-blowing. We paid $80 for a two-person meal that we could have gotten at a chain sushi restaurant for much less, while still tasting the same or better. My tekka maki (tuna roll - just tuna and rice wrapped in seaweed) had a very strong "fishy" aftertaste, which usually indicates that the fish is not super fresh.
author: Anna S.

description:
I went for the first time - I'm good with it all. 
Food excellent, fresh clean. 
Service excellent, 
Place is setup really nice. 
My wife and I drive out to the avenues a-lot to go to Sushi Tomo.. That place is a 5.  However living in North-water front area, this place is a definitely repeater.
author: Matt V.

description:
The menu on google is different than the menu provided by the restaurant. The prices on google are far cheaper. When I told the waitress about that, she rudely responded that the one on google is an old one and that they don't use it anymore. She did not even apologize about it, as if it were my fault I didn't know. It's a shame they still have not shut down the google menu, espacially that they know that it exists and that it is different and cheaper than the actual menu.
The sushi is okay, but the service is not that good at all.
author: Cyril J.

description:
You got a pretty good deal for getting their lunch special 3 item bento box. You can try multiple dishes without having to commit just to one.

The portions are quite small but you definitely feel very full after. It comes with a side of salad and a bed of rice. It also comes with a bowl of miso. The miso was pretty good but the salad was way too watery and the dressing was just okay.

I tried their shrimp combo tempura, it was nice not too greasy and didn't give me a MSG headache after. I also tried there spicy tuna rolls. It wasn't overly spicy and had a nice bite to it with the Cucumber. I also tried their pork katsu. The pork was awkwardly small but it tasted very good. pretty thin too.

Overall I like this place food wise much more better than Sushi Toni. For the fact that I liked the food better and that I didn't get a MSG headache.

The space is quite nice and has a bar as well. It's pretty big. I will definitely come back if I have a rental craving.
author: Lynn C.

description: Excellent sushi. Very quiet, fresh salmon, very original rolls as well as unique vegetarian rolls.
author: Anais B.

description:
Our favorite spot for sushi while in the downtown area. I've been here to many times to remember and it's always a good meal. It's a bit of a walk away from all the rush of the shopping area but it's great because I don't think many people will venture out here even though it's not even that far. 
Sashimi is fresh and service is good.
author: Nicole A.

description: The sushi here is solid. I tried a bento box with a veggie roll and California roll, and the salad, veggies and pickled cabbage were so good. I love finding sushi restaurants where it's clear they care about how their food tastes
author: Johanna G.

description:
I will never come back here. 

I've been sitting here for 1 hour and 20 minutes and have yet to have my order completed. 

They have yet to refill our waters... 1 hour and 20 minutes into the meal.. the server was pleasant but the restaurant operation is very less than desired. 

Avoid this place.. there are better places around. 

One annoyance is that the runners delivered our food and laughed about how long it took. Very.. unfortunate we chose this venue. 

Avoid. Do not come here. The sushi is not worth the month.
author: Kevin A.

description: I was looking for a good solid not overly expensive lunch and Maru Sushi delivered just what I was hoping for. I got the lunch three item special which is only about $15. It includes Miso soup, salad, rice, and 3 rolls. I'm not super adventurous so I got a spicy tuna, California, and Sashimi. All three were fresh and had excellent taste. I also enjoyed the wasabi. It had a really good late burn to it. If you're looking for a no-frills lunch that delivers ample sushi for a good price look no further. I knew I was in the right place when I sat down and the only utensils provided were chopsticks
author: Jude W.

description:
Love this place. Tiny yet pretty clean and friendly 
Close to the Square. Usually busy but the wait it short. Pretty good spicy ramen.
author: LL N.

description: Ate valentine's day lunch here. Small cafe near Union Square. Parking in Sutter St garage or BART Powell St. Station walking several blocks up Powell.  Lunch Bento boxes, pickled veg, and dragon roll were very good except for the salad lettuce which was brown, old, not crispy. Service was very good.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Not going back...one roll and bad tea $20 bucks. The place smelled bad like the Safeway fish counter. The dining area is sticky, the service was unskilled, I asked for water and miso soup with my roll and tea, just bad tea and then the roll. No check back to see if I'm ok, the place was empty just the lady at the counter counting the money. They are very eager for tips but the service doesn't support the entitlement. This area of Union Square is IN NEED of some good restaurants for the employees in the neighborhood, there's definitely a shortage of good food and service. 
I'll bring my lunch from now on.
author: C T.

description: Anyone who hates on this restaurant is either a megalomaniacal jerk, suffers from a deviated septum, or simply doesn't know a good sushi experience if their life depended on it. Hard to find a better combination of location/ambiance/quality food for the price in the city. Home run. Kevin, you're the man!
author: Mike K.

description:
With yelp's recommendation for nearby sushi place, I did order their rolls for my lunch. My order majorly depended upon pictures shows on its web, which look sufficient and tasty. 
The rolls were quickly served, but surprisingly the rolls' size was small enough to shrink 2 orders into one "normal" order's size. 
Taste? well, it's just so-so.
I don't know other's experience, but mine was not a pleasant one for sure.
author: She L.

description:
Unpretentious, delicious food and fantastic service. Do you need more than that? 
I guess if you're trying to impress someone, this might not be the place, but it's a great local spot.
author: Travis L.

description:
This place is disgusting. One of my friends got sick after coming to the restaurant. And we found hair on the sushi. The ramen is not ramen at all... is a shitty kind of something that wanted to be a ramen. They don't know how to make a bill, and of course, don't ask for different checks THEY HAVE NO FUCKING IDEA OF HOW TO MAKE IT. 
We were waiting for sushi rolls more than 45 minutes. The waitress was coughing over us. We ordered water and they bring it after the food and because we ask them three more times.
author: María D.

description:
I had a Kamakazi Roll, a Labamba Roll and some Hirame Nigiri. I really thought everything was quite good. The Hirame was especially nice. Maybe the best I've had. 
As far as Sushi goes, the rolls and Nigiri were properly constructed, and the fish was fresh. It isn't a fancy place. It's not real big, but bigger (in terms of seating) than many Sushi restaurants I've visited.
The two sushi chefs were really cranking out the product at a very fast pace, but I was there right at prime time. As a result, it wasn't the fastest service, but the quality was quite good, much better than most.
I was rather stuffed, but I don't regret any of it!.
I would definitely go back if I'm near Union Square and need to get my sushi on.
author: Phillip M.

description:
Really disappointed. I looked up their menu online- and ordered the regular sushi combo. Online it is $10.50. When I arrived to pick up my order, they charged me $22.95 ($25 total with tax). When I questioned the total and told the woman that rang me up that the price was $10.50 online, she just laughed in my face. 
Pull up the menu that is posted here- you'll see the combo under the section "Sushi Sashimi Combo", I ordered the very first one, $10.50. 
I would never spend $25 on a takeout lunch while I'm working. So very sad. 
The menus are incorrect on Yelp, Trip Advisor, Menuism, Allmenus,etc. 
I would appreciate someone to contact me regarding this price difference as it is clearly mis-posted all over the web.
author: Janell D.

description: This is the best sushi place in San Francisco, I was on vacation and I love it. It is walking distance from my hotel, I got the rainbow roll and it was delicious I will definitely order it again. I will be back soon! Definitely deserves five stars
author: Dylan Keville B.

description:
Overall my rating is between a 3 and a 4 star. There are not many great food options in this area...and Maru is pretty representative of the overall Union Square vibe. The sushi is passable - nothing bad about it, just nothing remarkable either. The prices are a little steep considering the quality of food you're getting. 

I went with a group of four and we tried a handful of different rolls. I thought that the service was fine. The venue itself is on the older side, and not particularly done up. Be warned that the restaurant is on a hill so you do have to do a little bit of climbing to get there. 

At the end of the day, if you really want sushi in this area and you absolutely can't go elsewhere/settle for anything else, then Maru isn't a bad choice!
author: Isabella C.

description:
Pretty unacceptable customer service, even for just getting takeout. I waited OVER AN HOUR for a takeout order (I was sitting on the bench in the front of the restaurant that whole time), and when it finally came out it was the wrong order. They said someone else had taken mine and that I could have hers instead. I asked for my money back and they said they could do a refund, but I couldn't keep the food. I had waited over an hour, it was the wrong order, the person who ordered it had already left so it was going to go to waste anyway, and yet they wouldn't just let me keep it along with my money. 

And that's how you lose a customer.
author: Dana F.

description: I wish the service was better but the sushi is really good if not the best. I recently discovered mango salmon sushi (might have a different name I don't remember) but oh my god!! So delicious! #musttry
author: Selen A.

description:
Tried this place as it was close to the hotel we were staying at. Service was good, waitress was very nice although she made a few mistakes... my girlfriend ordered the miso soup for herself and they mistakenly assumed I wanted a bowl too; I ended up getting charged for the bowl I declined and didn't eat. On the bright side, Sapporo on tap was only $5.00. 
As far as the sushi goes, we tried the Go-go and Spider rolls and both were just ok. The rolls were on the small side and they fell apart easily. 
This place was OK, nothing worth writing home about, and probably not worth a second visit unfortunately.
author: Javier M.

description: The sushi/sashimi combo is great if you are struggling to choose... the sashimi was amazing; the fish, especially the salmon and tuna was tender and melt in the mouth. There were a few mix ups with the order but everything was sorted quickly. Would go again!!!!
author: Sophie H.

description: Good, fresh food. I highly recommend the Powel roll and the oysters were huge! Employees were all VERY nice. A great casual sushi spot!
author: Taylor H.

description:
Go ahead, live dangerously.

I was already seated at the sushi bar and had placed my order for the most pedestrian of Japanese restaurant menu items (combination sushi platter, $18.95) when I pulled out my iPhone to facilitate a yelp check-in.  What's that, yelp?  This place received a food safety score of 67 on a 100 point scale in July?  Oy.    

The sushi chef grunted at me when I asked how his day was going.  "Complicated" he huffed.  

"Well, maybe it'll improve from here" I offered and got no response.  

Did I mention I was the only person at the sushi bar at that point? 

Despite the dismal health score the place looked clean but when you're consuming raw fish it's the unseen things that'll get you.  

The sushi platter begins with perfectly acceptable salad and miso soup.  What follows is about what you would find on any sushi platter anywhere.  6 pieces of nigiri and 6 slices of California Roll.  

Yawn.

The shrimp tasted a bit of ammonia (I don't even wish to know why) and another nigiri (the one on the far left in the photo) had an unfamiliar, unwelcome texture.  It all went down my gullet without incident, one of one million meals about which I can only say this:  The food was unmemorable.  The service was gruff (and then MIA when it came time to pay my bill), and despite the dismal food safety score, nothing made me ill.  

The woman working on my hair earlier that day had mentioned she eats at Maru, more because it's nearby than because she thought it was particularly good.  I'd second that but in this 'hood there's a whole lot of places nearby.  Places where the staff actually smile and places which receive far superior food safety scores.  Bottom line?  This place is okay but I'd look a bit further; you can find better in this part of town.
author: Tracey A.

description: My husband had the sushi which he said was absolutely fabulous.  I had the beef sukiyaki which unfortunately was just fair.  The beef was full of gristle in just about every bite which was very disappointing.  I did enjoy parts of my dish, mostly the juice over the rice...that was yummy.
author: Jan S.

description: What a great little spot. The calamari was delish. We had two rolls and they were both spot on. I would recommend this place especially if you are out shopping close, or are staying at the hotels close by.
author: Milla H.

description: This is definitely a hidden gem. The fish was so fresh and flavorful. Everything was excellent and I'm so happy we took a chance on this place. We were headed elsewhere and made a last minute decision to switch it up and get some sushi while I'm SF. We had two rolls and gyozas and it was perfect.
author: Jamie F.

description: I can't believed got charge gratuity for 2 adults and 1 kid. Please checking your bill before you pay.
author: Suparaporn P.

description: So good ! Yummy Yummy ! Maybe the best I've had as far as Sushi goes.
author: Linda M.

description: I got the bento box with 3 choices for lunch! Chicken Teriyaki, Tempura, and Spicy Tuna Sushi...service was great and friendly. Food was good as well.
author: Keith N.

description: I ordered two sushi rolls here.  They were some of the best I'd had.  I also ordered the chicken teriyaki and it was great.  The miso soup is as good as anywhere else.  The staff was friendly.  Overall a great, authentic experience.
author: Jason O.

description:
I come here often on my lunch breaks. The place is okay. They have gotten my order wrong more times than right and didn't offer any solution for their mistake. There were a few times I was in hurry and had to eat whatever they served me. 
Overall my experience is mixed. Sometimes it's good service bad food. Bad food good service. Good service good food. Bad service bad food. There's just no consistency. For a SF restaurant I would expect better. There are better sushi places, but in a pinch you could get decent food here.
author: Romeo A.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE!! We just ate here around 3pm on Feb. 11th, 2018. Honestly, most of what we ordered was just fine, but one roll, the Volcano roll (salmon), was very obviously spoiled. My bf and I each ate one piece of the roll at the same time and almost lost our lunches right there at the table. We immediately alerted our waitress who called the owner over. The owner said that it is not possible for her food to taste bad and basically told us both we were lying to save money. We told her that our bill is around $100 so why would we make this whole production to save $10?? After arguing back and forth, which was embarassing because at this point the entire restaurant was staring at us, she finally said that she'd give us 50% off that one roll.
I am usually extremely polite and non-confrontational, so we just paid and left to end this embarassing ordeal. I immediately reported them to the health department and am waiting for their analysis. (They take 7-21 days for a complaint like this so it will be a while.) I just really hope neither of us get sick.
author: Michelle W.

description: Went here with my wife and 2 year old son. Going out to eat dinner with a child is usually difficult. It's nice when the server helps with things like cup with lids or good booth seating. Server was not very conscience. She actually tried to take away all of our sauce dishes including the adults. It was uncalled for. Food was very average. We had he popular cherry blossom roll. No major flaws but it isn't worth going out of your way for. Also got a bento box. Very average.
author: Daniel H.

description: The menu is misleading. I came over for some quick fill me up to go food, and find out the price was 2x more than on the menu on Yelp. Disappointed.
author: Panda B.

description:
My dinner at Maru Sushi this evening was definitely not up to par. First off, the service was poor. It took more than 15 minutes for our waitress to take our order and another 5 minutes to bring us our waters in a restaurant occupied only by us. Not only that, but no on came by after we were done and I was unable to box up and take home my food. I ordered the beef sukiyaki ($17.95) and my friend ordered the mild tonkatsu ramen($11.95).

Sukiyaki:
- bland broth
- not many noodles
- tough beef

Ramen:
- Hard boiled egg, not soft boiled (over-boiled at that)
- noodles were nearly identical to 99 cent ramen noodles

 This is definitely not worth the money.
author: Andrew T.

description: Solid sushi spot in the City that has been consistent over the years!  Always fresh with specials like Toro, Uni and Hamachi Maru roll.
author: Glenn O.

description: Great quick lunch spot near shopping district.  Nothing super fancy, but tasty, healthy, light lunch.  I ordered the 2 item bento- salmon sashimi and tofu teriyaki.  Both were very good.  The coating on the tofu was really nice too, a stretch potato starch rather than the tempura batter many lazy Japanese restaurants use- it's a bit more authentic.  Salmon quality was also good- definitely fresh not frozen.  If they want 5 stars, they should get better quality rice.  Having lived in Japan, most Japanese people would find it a bit on the hard side and not as sticky as it should be.
author: Lindsey G.

description:
My latest favorite place and I have tried about 10 sushi restaurants in various neighborhoods in SF, including the Mission and Outer Richmond as well as Japan Town.

The service can be iffy at times but they are apologetic and nice. The place is clean and the environment is good.

Most importantly, the quality of the food is top notch and they know how to make rolls and I go straight to the counter and order directly from the sushi masters.
author: Amanda J.

description: Staying at the Kimpton one block down. Hotel receptionist recommended. The ambience food and service are all 5 stars. The miso soup was light and not too heavy. I got the caterpillar roll and it was exceptional. Highly recommend this place if in the area.
author: Sarah C.

description: We were there on vacation. Stayed right down the street. We stopped in in the sushi was phenomenal. They were a little bit short staffed but the food was great.
author: Robert C.

description:
Wanted to grab a quick bite before going back to the hotel. Quality of food wasn't anything special and left me quite disappointed. Tried 6 or 7 different rolls and honestly wouldn't recommend any of them. 
This is actually the only sushi I've ever had in SF so I am not sure if it was actually over priced or this is the norm in Bay Area. My bill was a little over $100 for two and I wasn't even half full so it felt a little bit pricy to me.
On the positive note the staff was really friendly. Service was not spot on since they brought the bill for me before I was done and was still expecting two more rolls. And the bill was not correct the first time (missing items, it was less than what it was supposed to be), second time it was just someone else's bill. Not a big deal though, the niceness of the staff was definitely outweighed the not so important mistakes.
I won't be back though.
author: Amir S.

description:
This was probably one of the worst sushi experiences in my life.
Not saying they are not nice people but the quality of fish is an insult to Japan cuisine.
author: Stephane R.

description:
Typical Union Square restaurant for tourists.

Overpriced, quality good, pay for tea unlike most Japanese places, and mochi was almost frozen
author: Sharon M.

description: Maybe it's because I'm from Vancouver and have high expectations, but when the spicy tuna roll is ground tuna, it becomes Japanese fast food. Very ordinary. Don't go out of your way to eat here
author: Jordan M.

description: Amazing sushi, amazing service and amazing location. Best prices in town! The spicy tuna was very spicy which was exactly what I was looking for. Ate at the bar and Kamui was awesome! Definitely gonna come back soon!
author: Ryan J.

description: Incredible and polite service. And the food came to my table fast and was super fresh. This place is highly under-recognized.  Such a friendly and relaxing and CLEAN environment. I visit San Francisco weekly, from Los Angeles... and this, by far is my favorite Sushi restaurant.
author: Jacob B.

description: Expensive but delicious sushi. Service was prompt and friendly. Tea was a tea bag in a large glass mug. Both nigiri and roll were well-prepared, well-plated, large and very fresh and yummy. Nothing particularly stood out, but I would definitely eat here again. In fact, I wish I were eating here again right now. :)
author: Michael B.

description:
Dragon roll and Spicy tuna was unbelievably good. They melt in your mouth and are so fresh! This is the best sushi that I have tried outside of Japan. Period! Everyone needs to stop searching for the best sushi in US and just come here.
This place is amazing.
author: Jay K.

description: I decided to order the ramen because it sounded good from the menu. I must admit, the presentation was nice. However, the ramen was clearly just two packs of instant ramen that they added a bit of garnish to. The egg was hard boiled so the center was dry. Nothing special at all and definitely not worth $10.
author: Henry D.

description:
2.5 stars.

Restaurant is a little dim and outdated, but there are always tables available. Service is pretty fast.

Extremely average lunch time bento.
2-item combo for $10 and 3-item combo for $12-13. You can pick from katsu, teriyaki, spicy tuna roll, california roll, salmon sashimi, tuna sashimi, gyoza, sauteed veggies, etc.
- Miso soup- average
- Salad- probably don't dry the lettuce, since it was watered down. Dressing is something like peanut and ginger.
- Rice- can sub for another portion of salad instead
- Tuna sashimi- 3 pieces, didn't taste that fresh but it was fine
- Spicy tuna roll- average
- Fish katsu- drenched in katsu and wasabi cream sauce, but not bad
author: Alice T.

description:
Stopped in here fore a Bento Box and it was pretty great. Vegetarian 3 item bento came with vegetable tempura, a veggie roll, and teriyaki tofu. Definitely a great place to grab a quick healthy lunch that won't leave you bloated.

The ambiance is nice, music was decent (Top 40), and the waitstaff were very friendly!
author: Anthony G.

description: Came here with my teammates before heading to the Color Factory down the block. Service was good, but the Tonkatsu ramen I ordered was too salty. I added chili powder to help with taste, but it definitely had me really dehydrated after. My co-workers enjoyed their sushi rolls, but the dishes weren't anything memorable.
author: Amanda C.

description: I stumbled across this place when I was staying at the Westin. The atmosphere is pleasant, they have a nice selection of daily specials and sake. The portions are decent and everything was delicious. I love their salad dressing, I just wish the small salad wasn't so small, it would be worth the price increase. The staff is polite, but check your bill. I ordered an item that they ran out of and it was still on the bill. Other than that, it was a pleasant experience and I'd eat here again in a minute.
author: JD H.

description: If I could give 0 stars, I would. They claim that their uni is "fresh" but there was a bitter flavor to it. The server claimed that the uni was from Japan and it was from the shell but the chef said that it was from Taiwan...? I'm not geography expert but I know for a fact that they are two different countries. The chef then proceeded to argue with us that they just got the uni from the package today but I thought that the server said it was from the shell. Also, the roll I got kept falling apart and there was a long piece of hair. The server wanted to charge us for the roll even if there was a hair in it. Excuse me, but I don't want to pay for a roll that I'm not happy about and that I barely even touched. When servers and the chef lie to a guest, it is the end of their business.
author: Rachel W.

description: Very neat place a few blocks from Chinatown. Read up on your sushi if you're not someone who eats it frequently. There are many options so it can get confusing. There are some vegetarian options as well. The sushi was fresh and well presented. The service is very friendly and helpful if you have questions. I will definitely go back for another meal.
author: Ameya C.

description: This is the BEST sushi place in SF! Tried Hamachi and Squids and 79ers, etc. It was delicious and keep ordering the fabulous sushi so on. Try here the best one and never regret!
author: Seungho J.

description:
I've been here 3 times, only because I usually stay at the Marriott across the street, and this j-restaurant is conveniently located. Each time I came, I sat at the sushi bar and was seated immediately, so I can't comment on the table service. I only order the freshest sashimi, sometimes at Chef's suggestions, and some sushi. The sushi Chefs have always been attentive, usually prompt, but realize that I'm spending a lot of dollars to get the freshest/best fish, so I would expect great food & service.  I stay away from ordering the Americanized stuff that mixes cream cheese, spicy mayo etc into sushi rolls, or the sugary teriyaki drenched meats.  This is an Americanized Japanese restaurant and that's the type of food most of you came here for, or is used to. Overall not the greatest place for food, but decent.

My only complaint is that they advertise fresh oysters for cheap (I think for $1.50 each?) to draw-in customers, but this restaurant has always been "sold-out" of them in all of the 3 times that I came here.
author: Joey S.

description: Too expensive,  small ass cooked rolls,  even the seaweed salad was just two tablespoons!!!   Only low sodium soy sauce,  wth!!  I will not be returning!
author: Ishtar P.

description:
I am a SF native and I know this place has been opened for a very long time. I don't understand why everyone else is giving this place low stars. This place is a gem!

The first time I came here was when I was about 6 or 7 years old (I wasn't a big fan then). I never went back until recently. I gave it another shot and I have to say that this place is really good. If you know what to order, it will be good. I really enjoy their udon because their soup actually has flavor unlike other restaurants. Their tempura is legit! Don't even get me started on their sashimi, it melts in your mouth. It is pretty fresh. Their rolls are actually pretty good because they're not like other restaurants where they either put too much sauce (which overpowers the sushi) or it doesn't have any distinct flavor.

The service is wonderful as well. Everyone is very nice and friendly. They're very accommodating.

I'd keep coming back again and again for their sashimi and udon. This place has become my favorite go to Japanese Restaurant. This is a legit Japanese restaurant. It's even better than the ones in Japantown.
author: Annie H.

description:
I went for an early lunch on Memorial Day (~11:30am) and was one of two parties in the restaurant. It was definitely nowhere close to capacity! When I walked in nobody was at the register/hostess counter but I was seated by a woman within a minute of entering. 

Also when I came in the front door was open, making the restaurant very cold when I sat down. Not sure about that. 

When I sat down, she gave me my menu and disappeared back to wherever she came from when I entered. I decided on getting a bento box within a couple minutes but she (now acting as waitress) didn't come back to my table for well over 5 minutes and closer to 10 minutes. I ordered my food and she was about to walk away before I requested a glass of water, which I would have thought would come out right away.

I got my bowl of Miso soup (included in the price) within a few minutes, and it was delicious! 

The food was prepared quickly and came out soon after, and at least and the presentation was top notch. The water was warm, unfortunately, and came out with the meal. I ordered a Spicy Tuna roll and Chicken Teriyaki (2 item bento box) for $10 and it came in a nice 5-compartment wooden box, along with a ball of rice in one, an orange and broccoli with sauce compartment, and a salad.

The food was excellent, thankfully! A great portion for the price and the rice was superb. The vegetables and meat tasted fresh and was very flavorful. 

During the course of the meal a few others entered the restaurant, and the hostess directed some to seat themselves and assisted others. Almost always the customers had to wait a few minutes before any staff noticed they were there. I'm not sure if it was standard operating procedure or it was just a setup time/busy morning, but I don't think that was a great way of entering the restaurant.

The music was loud and easily audible but was irrelevant to the decoration. Lots of pop and electronic chill music, but no commercials. 


While the meal wasn't out-of-this-world good, it's definitely a place I'd take a friend. I hope the service is better next time though, and I would have liked (ice) water a little sooner!
author: John B.

description:
this place is more like a 3.75
Ive came here twice and had pleasant experiences but nothing that blew me away.

The 1st time i came i ordered an Avocado roll and a house salad. The salad was great. You could tell veggies were super fresh and crunchy. My avocado roll was also great tasting but i didnt like that there were SO TINY. 
Seriously it looked like a tiny sampler plate. /: Since that tiny ass roll clearly wasnt gonna fill me up i ordered a cucumber roll which was JUST as small ): So i ended up playing $20 dollars that day and still felt hungry /: 

The second time i went i was hoping to get a bento but i didnt see anything about that on the menu so i had to order the platter thing (which is literally the same thing but not served in a box) for $18!!!!!!!!!! I got over the point that i was gonna pay that much and ordered the veggie roll & veggie tempura. The miso soup, rolls,rice, tempura and salad all tasted great but that price still killed me. Not sure if i'll return.
author: Xochitl T.

description: Convenience - open from 11 to 11. Other than that, I would avoid the place. I've eaten here twice now due to clients staying at the hotel across the street. Both time I had stomach issues afterward. Today we had lunch - all the fish dishes tasted fishy - especially the softshell crab. Never encountered this issue before as I often order it - must be the reused oil. Shrimp and sweet potato Tempura batter was good light and crunchy so the shrimp tempura was the salvo. The Hamachi Toro was decent. But the Hamachi Kama looked it was just hauled out of the freezer to defrost, and it was just not fresh. Again the overwhelming oily fish taste. We informed the waitress who took it away uneaten - yet we were still charged for it. Unless my clients insist on coming to this place - not coming back here. Neither should you.
author: Nancy T.

description:
Not too thrilled with this place.  I had the chicken katsu and the red devil sushi roll.  The katsu curry sauce came in a tiny dish and tasted nothing like katsu curry.  It tasted like a combination of popular japanese (teriyaki, ponzu etc) sauces.  It wasn't unpleasant but it wasn't katsu and there was so little of it.!  

The red devil sushi roll was OK.  I expected it to be spicy but it wasn't at all and at $15 it's a little steep.

Service was OK and the ingredients were decent but I won't go back.
author: Frank W.

description:
You're getting the real deal here.
Very authentic. They have a large menu and excellent service.

Free wifi!
author: Anisa A.

description:
Moderately priced. Great quality. Friendly exceptional service. 

I came in from out of town with a friend, we immediately sat at the sushi bar. Everyone was friendly. Speedy service and the food was delivered in the same fashion. The food was not over priced but not cheap I felt like I definitely got what I paid for. Would definitely visit again next time I'm in town.
author: Heather R.

description:
I am going to say 3.75 stars and round up.

Why? I had been putting off my sushi fix for awhile but while visiting SF it got the best of me. The restaurant was pretty full on a Sunday night at 8pm but service didn't suffer ( 2 servers)

Pros: tasted fresh and I loved the way they sliced the cucumber in the middle of the roll that added a crunch

I had the dragon roll and red devil: I didn't think they would be impressive when I saw them but the flavors were very fresh. Service was quick. You can in and out relatively quickly for a bite.

Con: pass on the tempura- it's a small portion for 8.5 

Yelp tip: my iPhone gps got a bit confused. It is on the corner of Powell and Sutter on the north side- diagonal from the drake. There a lot of people, sounds and such as it is the fringe of tourist central and lots of businesses. Basically look up the big hill- it's that direction about half way up the block- suck it up and earn your tempura!!!
author: Olga G.

description: I've got a beef teriyaki (with rice, vegetable, soup) and a matcha ice cream! I am alone and eat at the bar counter. One of the chefs is a nice Korean man! Nice service though!
author: Zoe L.

description: Great sushi, had a dragon Roll and Spicy tuna roll both melt in my mouth and the dragon had the right amount of crunch.
author: Ramon O.

description:
Five stars for presentation and flavor. Again five stars for variety ! Things here others forget. The chef here is very special thank you Emi for one excellent meal. 
I have this spot bookmarked !!!
author: Bruce B.

description: Great sushi & never very crowded! Unique sushi rolls!! Ume plum & shiso!! Great Atmosphere!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
It's just an OK place if you are starving and craving sushi and are near the area. Not worth the drive since there are better places around SF. Costumer service was extremely slow and it was half way empty inside. The rolls all came in at different times and we were almost done by the time they brought my friends teriyaki plate (which was about 20 minutes after ours).

Nothing special as far as the sushi taste. For the price you pay it's really not worth it. 
2 rolls that I would absolutely recommend not ordering are the volcano roll and the potato bug roll. Both had such a weird texture and flavors. 

Seems to be more of a sushi place for those who don't really know what really sushi tastes like so they settle for their sushi. If your'e a regular sushi eater I would not recommend.
author: Yelena G.

description:
Like several other reviewers, I wish Yelp would let me give fractional stars. This is not really a 4-star place, but it's better than a 3.   3.5 stars, rounded up.

Maru offers standard sushi, done well.   Very good, no complaints.  Fresh,tasty, good service.  Authentic-feeling Japanese atmosphere and service.  

I've eaten here many times (it seems that whenever I'm in San Francisco, I always end up at a hotel an easy walk from here) and I've never been disappointed.  

On the other hand, don't expect any big revelations here.  I've had sushi just as good at dozens of places, and far better at several others.  So while I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the neighborhood, I wouldn't trek across town just to come here.
author: Steve L.

description: In the city to watch a play, so we chose a place to eat that was within walking distance of the Theatre. This was our first time trying Maru Sushi and we were all very pleased. We had a reservation, but there was no problem getting a table at 5:00 on a Wednesday night. The chef made us 4 delicious rolls. Prices vary depending on which online menu you look at. Four specialty rolls, order of spicy green mussels, one miso soup and a couple of drinks was $70. Worth every penny for us. We will definitely go here next time we are in the  area.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Food was good here but having good food is only a small part of the business.....it's all about customer service.  Especially at a Japanese restaurant when service and presentation is everything!  I hate when the server doesn't ask if you're done before taking your plate away when there's still food on your plate and putting another dish on top of it.  It's too late!  Who wants to eat after my miso soup bowl went on my dish!
Very bad!
author: Sheri K.

description: Great neighborhood sushi. Walked in after the gym,  15 mins before closing, craving salmon and tuna. I opted to dine. I know that's a nightmare for restaurants, a single customer just 15 mins before closing. But the service was amazing and the food was fresh and very quick! Tasted amazing. Big thanks, neighbors! It's just what the doctor ordered
author: B G.

description:
Came in on a Tuesday night and it was busy. 
Ordered the chicken teriyaki and a lion king roll. 
The chicken was charbroiled and it was very good. It came with miso soup which was very good, salad and rice. 

We ordered fried ice cream which was good too. 
Service was ok. It was like they were too busy to think about giving us menus and straws.
author: Veronica H.

description:
We enjoyed our meal but it wasn't spectacular. We both ordered the chicken teriyaki which came with miso soup, salad, and rice. The miso soup was very good! The salad dressing didn't have much flavor. The chick n was fresh but wasn't seasoned too well- the teriyaki sauce  as good but more would have been helpful.

The staff was very friendly, however a little understaffed.

Chicken teriyaki- $15.49
Soda- $2.50
author: Amy S.

description:
Maru Sushi has some pretty darn fresh fish.  I'm surprised that Maru only has an overall rating of three stars when their fish is of such high quality!  Maybe I just came on a good day?

My chirashi bowl ($19.95) was, in a word, phenomenal.  Honestly, it was one of the best chirashi bowls I've had since Musashi's, in my hometown of Seattle.  Each piece of fish had the perfect texture, flavor, and slight springiness when pressed gently with a chopstick.  I savored every bite of nigiri (mackerel, shrimp, buttery tuna, roe, salmon, and one beautifully prepared scallop) and even the sweet tamago egg.  The nigiri was arranged so artfully over a bed of vinegary-sweet sushi rice with a sprinkling of sesame seeds.  I took a couple chopstickfuls of my boyfriend's katsu curry ($9.95) and it had that sweet and wholesome flavor of Japanese curry.  He enjoyed it very much.

Did I mention that each of our dishes came with complimentary miso soup (even the soup tasted better than most!) and salad with a refreshingly light dressing?

Service was both friendly and pleasant.  Although it took some time for us to be seated, once we were, the waitresses were extra attentive to our requests.  The prices here are pretty average for a Japanese restaurant, but the fish is so darn good I wouldn't mind coming back for another chirashi bowl!
author: Brittany N.

description: Great company made the dinner here special. It's in a pretty good location in Union Square.  There's a good variety of rolls and it all seemed pretty fresh.
author: Patricia N.

description:
They're the best in the neighborhood and a lot better in many ways than all of the Japanese Restaurants I've been to here in San Francisco. 

No other restaurant can serve Uni like they do. Servings of Uni are sweet and fresh.

Aside from the wide range of selections they have, you could tell that the food is cooked and prepared with utmost sincerity. You can't find that in just any Japanese restaurant here in San Francisco. I've been to a lot, but nobody serves food like they do at Maru.

Hard to believe?
Try the following
Seafood Udon
Uni
Katsudonburi
Salmon Skin Roll
Godzilla Roll

I feel so lucky to find this place. Everyone's friendly and sincere. The sushi chefs have the best sincerity you seek in anyone preparing sushi.

Enjoy!
author: John Michael L.

description: Really excellent, fresh fish and friendly service!  The toro (blue fin tuna belly) was outstanding.
author: Alyssa H.

description: I know this is a sushi place and that is their specialty but I was significantly underwhelmed by what  $15 bought me... I have had fried rice from gourmet japanese sushi places before... usually in a group... and received more than twice what I received here... very disappointing and gave me a sense that this was service based than the norm
author: Anthony G.

description: Sushi was amazing and fresh! It's close to union square and has affordable prices. Their dragon roll and spivey scallop cone was amazing. Their sashimi was also really good!
author: Winston L.

description: Great food but their menu prices are way more expensive than what's on here! Had 2 fancy rolls (spider and rainbow) they were MASSIVE I was stuffed. 30 bucks including tip.
author: Maddy H.

description: What a great spot!  Easy to find, fresh ingredients, and quick service.  I had the Powell Roll and it was amazing!  The beer pricing is cheaper than most other places in the area too, so that is a plus.  For a large Kirin it was only $7.00.  I was able to get out of this place in under 30 minutes too.  Overall a good find!
author: Kristy R.

description: Sushi at its best with unique servings! Great service. Will definitely be coming back. Reasonably priced
author: Del B.

description:
Seat for one at the sushi bar! Fast and friendly service! Had many tables occupied but didn't seem overwhelmed as I had the sushi bar all to myself. 

I ordered the Rainbow Roll which was amazing! I'm a picky sushi eater and I always enjoy a good Rainbow Roll with shrimp tempura in the center (most sushi restaurants offer with a California Roll center). The assorted fish were all fresh and the tempura was still warm. Can't wait to come back and try more!
author: A. C.

description: Wow!!I was lucky stubble to this amazing. The food was Fresh and very tasty and beers on tap was cold!!my server name Jeanette she took real care me. She very well spoken and make sure I always have everything I need without over doing it. The rest of the crew was very welcoming it. The place super clean, I'm in the services business and the first thing I look for if the bathroom clean !! Wow you can eat in restroom, that's number in my opinion. If the restroom well kept you can trust everything else clean. Support your local business always. Thank you for all you do!!
author: Phong L.

description:
I've been to this place several times, always getting the lunchtime Bento. It's a reliable fairly cheap lunch in Union Square. Nothing amazing but certainly good enough. This time, I ventured from the Bento and ordered the curry donburi. It's vegetarian, and when it arrived I found that it was potatoes, carrots, and a few peas in curry sauce over rice. Unfortunately with the first bite it was obvious that the potatoes were overcooked, and possibly not very fresh in the first place. I mean, how do you mess up potatoes in curry sauce? It just wasn't good. It didn't taste fresh, and the fact that it was only the potatoes and carrots and a few peas meant that I couldn't ignore that the potatoes weren't good. 

When I put it aside, the hostess asked if everything was okay, and I told her that I didn't care for it, and then it didn't taste very fresh. She responded by saying "oh no it's very fresh we made it last night!" Somehow hearing that your food was made the day before it does not inspire confidence in its freshness. Do they sometimes serve curry that's even older than one day? I again said "it's not good." She responded by saying "oh no it's very good." And walked away. 

The other waitress noticed that I wasn't getting , and asked if it was okay,  so I explained. And again she just sort of said oh and walked away. There was no offer to replace it, or to remove it from our bill. So, I wound up paying for it and ate half of my friends Bento. It was clear that I was going to have to make a scene to get it taken off the bill, and I just didn't feel like it. And that was that. I won't go back.
author: Jamey M.

description: This is my favorite Japanese Restaurant right now. I like Ramen. it was superb. And tge waitress was nice too. price is acceptable.
author: Saran P.

description: Honestly my favorite Japanese restaurant, i go here all the time since it's close by my work. Only place that has tofu teriyaki that tastes good & isn't DRENCHED in teriyaki sauce! I only eat Sweet potato & broccoli tempura & they accommodate me every single time. Lovely people.
author: Jasmine E.

description: Clean looking. Service was fast and friendly. I had the three item bento box. Salmon teriyaki which was very dry, spicy tuna roll- (where's the tuna)very small and the tempura veggies which were probably the best item of the three. Salad needs to be dried so the water and dressing doesn't water down.  Overall a 2.5 rating.
author: Jim R.

description: Solid sushi. Not pretentious and just really yummy. Not super high end tuna but good enough. It's just what you expect (and maybe more) for the price range. Staff are awesome and the service is fast. Don't skimp on the tip!
author: Chris H.

description: First time coming here. They were busy and took about 15mins to be seated. Once seated it took another 30mins before anyone even acknowledged us or ordered even drinks. Services sucked the whole time. Food wasn't too bad. Not great or rememberable.
author: Nicky S.

description: Nice place, and good for a quick bite. The fish is very fresh, and they have beautiful food presentations. A little overpriced, but not much more than other restaurants in SF. Also, the workers are hospitable. If you're planning on eating here and you like fresh fish, I recommend the Sake Mango roll. It's amazing!
author: Sarah F.

description: This was the best sushi we have ever had. Fish was fresh and flavorful. They were a little under staffed and it was a bit of a long wait for our sushi. (3 rolls) overall we will definitely be back. Super good.
author: Nina V.

description: It's ok...nothing outstanding. I'd eat there again but if someone asked about a good sushi place I don't think it would come to mind.
author: Rowland A.

description: This place is the perfect lunch/brunch spot. The bento boxes are fairly priced for the customers and offer a variety of options for those who want to taste various items. The selections include cooked meats, sushi, and deep fried items as well. The portions are good sized and you can have a full meal without the need for an appetizer or desert. Also you won't feel stuffed or lazy afterwards! I highly recommend Maru for a quick lunch/brunch destination.
author: Michael O.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite to eat! Boy were we surprised! Service was quick, sashimi was very fresh. The miso soup was served piping hot (good thing because it was brisk out yesterday!) They only serve beer, wine, and sake. We sat at the sushi bar. A waitress takes your order. The sushi chef was awesome. He checked on us quite a few times as well as he made us some really cute little sides that we did not order. The bathrooms were very clean. The restaurant is super cute and very traditional. Definitely stop in when in town!
author: NY F.

description:
Around the corner from the hotel i stayed in
I was one of the very first americans to eat sushi back in 1972 in new york city and was impressed with the fresh fish and friendly people
author: Sioux K.

description:
The whole time I was eating I was debating whether to give Maru 3 stars or 4. Although Yelp doesn't allow it, 3.75 seemed the appropriate rating, and I laughed when I logged on later and saw other Yelpers said that as well. Then, when I got the check, I made my final decision (see below).

First the good: service was fast and friendly. The sushi cuts were fresh and tasty, although definitely not the best I've ever had. There were some cuts clearly showing their age in the case. The cuisine is inventive, as the 49er roll I had came with a razor-thin lemon wrapper. It was indeed tasty if a *bit* sour. I ended up removing the lemon on 2-3 cuts, but overall I applause Maru's zeal in using peel. The building itself is one of the most traditional restaurants I've been too. Took me back to numerous Tokyo trips. If you similarly have pangs for long past trips to the land of the rising sun, the ambiance alone makes it worth a single stop. 

The not as good: the price. My roll was $13.50 which although not setting records for sushi was clearly on the higher side considering what you can get for the same money at other local fish slice-and-dicers. The price ended up helping me decide on a clear 3-stars. I tarried over the food though before this. As noted, it was "good" but definitely not great. Beyond the fish as mentioned above, the edemame was clearly microwaved. The seaweed salad was tasty but not winning any Michelin stars. 

Overall, if I was close to Union Square and wanted to bring a date here without walking far, I'd come here for the ambiance and expectations she wouldn't turn up her nose at the food. But if I wanted to impress a date, or enjoy a higher caliber cut myself...or save money...I'd go elsewhere.
author: Christopher M.

description: As the first dinner I had in SF, Ramen is so great that I ate too much. I will have lunch there today to try more sashimi.
author: Tian T.

description: Loved the vegan sushi options - the veggie and avocado rolls.
author: Rachel E.

description: Excellent food, presentation and service. Beautifully decorated restaurant.  My husband and I had a fabulous dinner.  Thank you!!
author: Roxanne S.

description: the waitress is so disgusting.when I came in, no body answer to me and then let me seated a corner small temporary table. I ordered 3 urchin sushi. she told me 18$ each. i reply 3 order. she said ：" are you OK with the price？"
author: Aline X.

description: It's unfortunate the experience ended as it did.  The start was good, great oysters, tea, sake, roll.  We also ordered a tonkatsu ramen. Unfortunately it wasn't what we expected and have had variations of at dozens of Japanese restaurants. For us it was missing the braised, salted pork that is typical of this style of noodle in our experience.  That aside, if they had handled it better when we tried to send it back it wouldn't have been such a bad experience. They argued with us and we refused to pay for that dish. After talking with 2 or 3 people and canceling the other dish we had ordered, we got a bill that correctly reflected what we had received and eaten.  Won't go back.  Side note, after eating here I see the yelp alert about this restaurant receiving low scores from the food health authority.....
author: Kris W.

description: The sushi & sashimi combo was fantastic.  Service was great and fast and well worth the money!!!
author: Scott R.

description:
Extra friendly and great service! I walked in by myself and felt right at home at the sushi bar!

Exactly what I was looking for. Fast, fresh, easy and delicious!
author: Dennis R.

description: Tried out this place for lunch. Not bad. $13 for 3 item combo bento is a good deal. I ordered spicy tuna roll, ton katsu, and salmon sashimi. They had a good variety of options to choose from. Plus rice, salad, and miso soup. We also ordered the rainbow roll which was pretty good quality as well. Fish tasted fresh.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Update 5/24/2016:  I came here again even the past two times here was bad but it was so close to work, this time my server is Vicky and she is super and very helpful, food was fast and very attentive, I'm changing my review to 5stars because of her awesome service and I'll come back again!



I want to give them one star, but at the end the server thank me sincerely so two instead.  It's a family business after all.  I ate here every week since its next to work, the food is usually good and service is what it keep me coming back.  Even though they never ever come up and chat me up, but the"thank you" is alway there.  But today I'm so disappointing by the service, I ordered take out at the door.  She is so business, I was standing there for 10mins before I can order, and I'm waiting for another 15mins for my sushi (yes one Alaska roll sushi $7.95, I give $10 so there is a good tip for take out) and I only have 45mins lunch.  The sushi chef isn't even making my order, he is showing customer?! his cell phone.  And the roll is much smaller then usual.  I might not come back again.
author: HL W.

description: The service is very slow. The waitress was unresponsive on our calls and their attitude was not so good too...
author: Yuya Y.

description:
We came here after our run and it was great.  They were able to accommodate us 3 quickly.  The miso soup stocked our low sodium levels and was delicious.  The combination was pretty good ($17.95 for two items).  The sashimi (yay protein!) comes out on a separate plate like a separate order and so does the entree.  No tacky bento boxes here.  The tonkatsu tasted homemade and the breading was lightly colored and light how I like it.  It was pretty good.  And I almost ate all of my white rice (glycogen!).  I'd definitely come back.  Service was friendly and efficient.  No tourists, just neighborhood eaters here.  BF really liked it too.

Next time, we'll come with our bigger running crowd!
author: Chris L.

description: By far my favorite place for a great dinner downtown. Great location. Kind Staff. Delicious rolls. Bento boxes SLAY. Date nights here are priceless.
author: Jasenia Q.

description: I understand they're busy at sunday nights, but i sat there waited for an hour, and the waitress didn't even care putting down a cup of water and never ended up taking my order.
author: Rae H.

description: Average food - came here for a quick dinner before show. I tried the seafood udon. Barely any seafood...disappointed.
author: MC C.

description: First time trying this restaurant hoping to satisfy my hunger. However, when I first stepped into the restaurant, that was when everything went downhill. The service was absolutely terrible. The waitress was rude and impatience. Also, they were very cheap when asked for straw for every person in our large party. After 10 minutes, she comes back with only 4. Secondly, we waited 40 minutes for our food when the restaurant was quite empty. And when we got our order of grilled Mackerel and chicken katsu, the portions were ridiculously small. Only one mouth full. Lastly, they include at 18% mandatory service tip that we are not notified about. What made it worse was that they didn't deserve it. Their service was under performed and not of par with that they asked for. Overall, terrible experience.
author: Justin T.

description:
Bad experience getting take-out here. 

1) their prices advertised online do not reflect what they actually charge. I paid way more than I expected when I arrived. Time to update their prices on online menus. Their advertising is deceptive. 

2) they didn't specify the California roll was imitation crabmeat. Their menu made it sound like it was real. 

3) they didn't provide nearly enough soy sauce for the amount of sushi I ordered. 

I won't be going back.
author: Frank R.

description: I got there at 12:15 and was seat by the chef at the bar. 3 mins later i ordered. About 12:36 i got my food. It was a bento with sliced beef, tuna sashimi and spicy tuna roll. The roll was ok but unfortunately my sliced beef was horrible. It looked like they mixed the left over with some new stuff. Also the beef was too dry and chopped. On the other hand, sashimi was sickly. Overall, although the food wasnt good at all but the staff is nice. But i won't come back again.
author: Nh Qunh P.

description:
Fast, hot and delicious. Miso soup is heaven. Spicy tuna hand roll is to die for. Veggie tempura was scalding hot and crispy tender deliciousness. dragon roll was to die for. And yes, I devoured it all. 

What's all this about bad service? Everyone was very friendly and service-oriented. 

I would easily recommend this Union Square spot
author: Linda G.

description:
My experience eating here today (Sunday June 15) was definitely worth five stars. I visited in the early afternoon for lunch and ordered two fresh oysters and the nigiri combination plate.  The total bill including tax and tip was just under $30.

I'll get to the food in a moment, but the first good thing was that the men's bathroom looked and smelled clean, and it was adequately supplied with hand soap and paper towels for washing any public transportation remnants off my hands before enjoying my meal.  I appreciate restaurants that take care to make sure the bathroom isn't gross.

The service today was very good.  The waitresses were friendly and attentive and I didn't have to wait at all before they gave me a menu and asked me what I wanted to drink (water and green tea).  Slight disappointment at the temperature of the tea.  I would have preferred it to be a bit more hot than it was, but it wasn't a big enough deal for me to ask them to heat it up.

I chose to sit at a table at the front so I could look out the window and watch the cable cars full of tourists going up and down the slope that is Powell Street between Bush and Sutter.  The weather was good today and they all seemed to be having fun.

OK, as to the food, it was clearly very fresh and it was delicious.

The oysters were served with a tasty mignonette which nicely complemented their flavor without overpowering that fresh taste of ocean that I love so much.  I should have gone with the half dozen instead of getting just two.  Next time I will.  My server didn't say, but to me it looked they were kumamoto oysters, and they set me back $4.95 which seemed a reasonable price.

The nigiri combination, $17.95 for 8 pieces, was nicely prepared and everything on the plate looked, smelled, and tasted very fresh and delicious.  When I requested no tuna (I really don't care for it), the sushi chef substituted with a second salmon nigiri and the salmon was outstanding.  Everything from the shrimp to the yellowtail was excellent, but hands down the salmon was my favorite thing on the plate.  It felt like it was melting in my mouth.  The sushi rice had very good texture and was nicely seasoned, and the fish-to-rice ratio was the way I like it: big fish, little rice and not the other way around.
author: Claus C.

description:
Food was decent. Nothing spectacular, but not bad. The restaurant is a couple of blocks from Union Square, and it was a convenient stop on a Friday night without reservations.

Service was pleasant, and food came out in a timely manner, except for 1 item. Two servers were asking if we were ready for our check, but we had to remind them that we had 1 more item coming. I guess they lost that part of our order. I'm guessing they lost it because it finally came out and they immediately gave us a free beer to go with it.

So, this is a decent spot if you're craving Japanese and in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: Martin S.

description: This is a fantastic option for those looking for an affordable and high quality sushi restaurant.    The location is very convenient and the staff is beyond friendly.   The food is consistently great as well.   Highly recommended.
author: A S.

description:
Her we are never disappointed with our food.  The beef teriyaki was delicious and had a lot of wonderful sesame seeds and even some mushrooms!  The flavor was well balanced and yummy! 

I tried a new sushi roll:  mango sake roll.  It was awesome! It's my new favorite! Fresh salmon, ripe mango, spicy crab, crunchy, and a tangy honey mustard sauce!   I would never thought to combine these flavors but I'm glad I decided to try it. It was perfect! 

We also ordered the baked mussels which were prepared fresh but I thought the preparation was a bit salty.
author: Sheila N Matthew W.

description: The people here were very nice. But I ordered the abalone as nigiri which I thought was going to be two pieces. Instead I received the whole abalone and was charged 25 dollars for it. It wasn't even good to be honest. I wish the waitress would've explained that to me instead of rushing to put my order in.
author: Kelly T.

description: Super yummy! It was one of the only sushi restaurants open at noon on Sunday near us. We walked here from the O'Farell garage before seeing a show at the Curran. Service was fast and friendly. Miso soup was one of the best I've had -- flavorful but light, savory but not salty. The Cherry blossom roll was topped with a lot of salmon, and the dragon roll was also fantastic. The restaurant itself has a great vibe. The skylights offer a lot of natural light, even on rainy San Franciscan days. We will be back!
author: Allison P.

description: The service is terrible. We lost our credit card after paying the bill. The waitress shows no patience to help us find it, so we end up being calling the credit card company to cancel the card and order a new one. However, the food actually is not that bad. We ordered Tempera Udon, fried oyster and one kind of sushi roll. We enjoyed the first two of them. Therefore, one star it is.
author: Lindsay W.

description: New discovery. Very good choice for sushi place. Try their Geisha Roll - the best! Will be back for sure specially its around the corner from my work
author: Stella N.

description: It feels like $5 each at others. And they sells their shit for $15.do not go there .Help yourself with some thing better.
author: Kay G.

description: Only because it was Christmas they can have 2 stars. Service was below average. Server didn't know what kind of oysters they serve, or the market prices for at least 2 items on the menu. Just saying; it's a good idea to know these things at the restaurant you serve. Clam miso soup came out lukewarm; I like my soup hot. Sushi was ok, seaweed was not crisp.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
On a recent visit to what was my favorite city for many years - until I moved to Chicago....Wait! That needs some clarification. I may have moved but I'm still a Giants fan and a Niners fan. 

Back to sushi. Doing the airbnb thing near Union Square, I set out to find a nearby sushi place. The usual suspects were all jammed up so I wandered around not so aimlessly until I stumbled upon Maru Sushi.

At first I was a bit hesitant as the place was fairly empty. Hunger trumped (I'm not sure if any word with t-r-u-m-p in it should be allowed) hesitancy so I took a seat at the sushi bar. I was greeted warmly and enthusiastically by the sushi chefs, both of whom looked like they've been doing sushi for many years (years trump - there it is again, that word! - youth). 

Feeling frisky for fish, I ordered a Kirin and small bottle of unfiltered sake and asked the sushi chefs if they would think of me as both sushiphile and sushinewbie. The trick question didn't confuse these Senmon-ka. Immediately, they motioned the waitress to take away my menu. Then they went to work creating an amazing array of nigiri, sashimi and rolls. The only thing I asked was that they don't slip me any squid (I harpooned a squid once in the Andaman Sea and I can still see its ink enveloping me).

Everything was fresh, nicely and respectfully presented. 

So here's the thing - try Maru Sushi, you won't be disappointed, even if the hipsters are somewhere else. Don't order off the menu - ask the sushi chefs to create things for you, you'll be a happy sushi camper.

There endeth the lesson, grasshopper.
author: Hendrix B.

description: Pretty decent sushi. We had the dragon roll and crunchy roll. Both had good flavor and the fish tasted fresh. Not my favorite sushi, but it was good. They also give you a nice cup of tea. The only con was that it took a really, really long time for our order to come out even though there were only a couple of other tables filled at the time. I didn't see takeout orders go out so I'm not sure what accounted for the delay. Even so, our waitress made sure our tea cups were full and the ambiance was nice.
author: Susan G.

description: In the mood for noodles and sushi, we stopped for a quick dinner. Yaki soba and Powell roll - perfectly satisfied us. Fresh, tasty, large portions. Highly recommend.
author: Lisa W.

description: It seems that the other reviews are sort of hit-or-miss, but I was here on a chilly post-Christmas evening when other nearby and highly rated sushi restaurants had 2+ hour waits. Even with a line out the door, I got seated almost immediately. The service was efficient and quick, and the sushi was good, too. Sure, you could get more spectacular sushi elsewhere, but Maru is a good choice for a decent dinner. Good Top-40 soundtrack playing in the background, too.
author: Jack B.

description: Consistently fresh selection of sushi specials for anyone graduating from the sushi bar basics. Husband and I were extremely happy with our meal, mostly ordered from their specials menu: hamachi collar, chicken karaage, uni, ankimo (monk fish liver), toro (fatty tuna), sea bream, butterfish. Besides freshness of fish, their rice seasoning is on point (light, vinegary & nutty)! Great food at great prices. We'll be back!
author: Yi Jia C.

description: 25 minutes wait in the empty restaurant for one "Rainbow roll". Made an order by phone and came 15 minutes after, as they said, still have to wait. Strong chemical smell inside like a bleach or something. Unpleasant. With so many sushi restaurants around, you have to try better guys. Sushi itself was ok, nothing special, really not worth the $15.
author: Daria M.

description:
The service and food were excellent! We were about to order a two-item bento with tempura rolls and spicy tuna rolls on the side, but the waitress told us it would be cheaper to just get a three-item bento with the third item being the spicy tuna rolls, which was nice of her to do. 

There were only two waitresses serving and bussing, and the place started to get slammed not long after we arrived, but I was impressed with how quickly they served us.

There are tons of other sushi places around, but I like the look and feel of this one.
author: Jona H.

description:
I'm a regular of sorts here since I frequent an office on Sutter Street, and this place is literally right off Powell, so it's a really easy walk whenever I'm on lunch.

It's unfortunately located on a slope, but luckily the architecture is pretty standard.  The staff here is very attentive.  The complimentary hot tea has a tasty corn flavor and they'll refill your cup just as you finish.

I always order a baked roll here.  My favorites are the Lion King and Volcano rolls.  The only thing I don't like about the rolls is that they easily fall apart when you try to pick them up with your chopsticks.

I've never tried a daily special yet, but I plan to soon.

All in all, this place isn't bad at all.
author: Danreb V.

description: Not great, not bad. The sushi was kind of warm so that was unpleasant. Udon noodles were good, but broth was just warm. Not hot. I'd try them again, maybe it's a bad night?
author: Stephanie M.

description: I am coming here for dinner on sat.  Ordered  ramen noodles.  The only one on the Manu. It was sooo salty.  Can hardly finish!   The two items dinner combo. Was bad too.  Fish was so dry.
author: Gigi C.

description:
As someone from the midwest, how could I leave San Francisco without stuffing my face with some sushi?

I stumbled into the quaint Maru Sushi ready to devour some rolls and contribute to the soon-to-be extinction of the wild salmon and tuna populations. To do this, I ordered the 49ner and the Dragon.

49ner: Being a Vikings fan, I despise the 49ners and I really didn't like this roll too much either.  I believe the roll consisted of crab with topped salmon with lemon. Ehh, the lemon overpowered the roll and I couldn't really taste too much of anything.
