Dragon: Crunchy, slightly salty, oyester-saucy - it was everything I could ask for in a Dragon Roll. It more than made up for the previous one and definitely left me wanting more.

I loved the speedy and friendly service. If I ever stay in downtown again, I would consider returning.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Good sushi and selection of roles. Lack of comprehensible English which isn't acceptable from a place in central SF. The wifi is dodgy and their Oy answer when not connecting is "wait" 

The quality is balanced but there are no positive or negative surprises. Be careful of the waitress, dropped the coke glass twice.
author: Laith A.

description:
Would not return here. We should have yelped before deciding on the restaurant :0(
The sashimi was poorly sliced. The tempura batter was not the traditional light batter. It was more crispy. They forgot the dressing on the salad. Almost gave us someone else's order. The edamame was cold.
author: Dale H.

description: My friend and I were craving sushi for lunch so we decided to give Maru a try. I've walked by the restaurant tons of times, but never ventured in due to its proximity to Union Square. The restaurant was super quiet we walked in, which was a little awkward. Our server was quick to get us seated and take our order - even before we had opened the menu. We ordered edamame and miso soup to start, and started gabbing away. The server came by three or four times afterward to take our order, which I thought was a bit pushy. The miso soup was tasty and salty (I normally add a dash of soy sauce for added flavor, but it wasn't necessary this time). The edamame was fine, nothing special. We also ordered the 49er roll, crazy roll, and spicy tuna roll. The crazy roll was by far my favorite - it was packed with a random assortment of fish. The other two rolls were also good, although a tad pricer than I expected. The server was good about refilling our water glasses, although slow with processing the check. All in all, a good sushi spot, but would not be my go-to. The vibe/ambiance could be spruced up, and the rolls a little less expensive.
author: Regina L.

description:
If there was an option to select zero stars instead of just one I would. This was the WORST sushi experience I have ever encountered. 

I absolutely dread writing horrible reviews because it is a waste of time and energy but I wish someone did earlier to save me from such a horrible experience.

BACK STORY: The initial visit was on 2/28/16 around 2pm with a party of 5 including myself. We were all tourist in SF on a quick trip to union square. We also all happen to be craving sushi because we are all frequent eating and sushi lovers. Found this spot randomly walking around and thought it was fate. The restaurant had two other customers but was pretty much empty (SUPER SLOW). Thought that was a sign of bad service but Yelp gave it 4 stars so we just decided to go with it.

THE STORY IF YOU CARE: Upon our arrival, viewing the menu wasn't very clear. Tons of options but little did we know it would be so strict with pretty much basic sushi if you wanted a "deal" otherwise you're better off just ordering the expensive rolls for a better taste. Right off the bat our server/waitress was extremely rude and brief. I asked her if we could split checks within our party so we can order accordingly just to make it easier for her. She yelled at me and told me we would do it at the end. She had ZERO patience to explain the menu when asked questions and rushed us to order. Her assumptions caused confusion and chaos as well as ordering the completely wrong thing I asked for. Thinking that I ordered the deluxe meal (10 pieces of Nigiri and a roll that I thought was your choice) she was extremely rude when the sides were given and ordered my party not to give me the miso soup since all of their orders included the following. She was extremely rude about it. I continued to keep my patience and politeness. We waited an hour and a half for our food in a empty restaurant and over the course of time asked her several other times for water because she kept forgetting and we were dying of thirst. Around the third hour everyone received their food except me with only receiving one roll.m and waiting for the nigiri. Once we realized, we acknowledged her that I had wanted the deluxe special. Clearly we misinterpreted the order on both ends but if she explained the menu better and wasn't in such a hurry the mistake would've been prevented. That is completely her job to help the customer. She quickly left the table to tell the chef about the order with once again not caring to understand what we exactly asked for. As soon as I could get her attention again I asked her how long would it take and she rudely interrupted me and was so quick to answer my question and (AGAIN not listening to me) gave me the wrong reply. She then lied and said the chef made it already. I no longer was hungry but didn't want make a scene or ruin the time I had with my party. At this point I just wanted to leave and ask for the check. Lastly, she confused our checks (that I tried to prevent) charged me for the deluxe meal and two extra rolls. I pretty much paid $83 including my partner's meal and a picture of beer. The outcome was for a half empty stomach and bad attitude. I would've never paid that price but then I remember that she was an older lady probably working for her family and I didn't want to take it out on them.

OVERALL: Customer service is extremely important and can make or break a business. I just hope no one has to go through this situation and this saves them the time and trouble. The worst part was the service was so terrible the sushi may have been good but the entire experience left a disgusting taste in my mouth. I will never visit this place again even if I was starving.
author: Alani E.

description: I started coming here for my sushi fix since I started working almost next door to it.  I love the Labamba roll!! :-)  definitely my go to lunch spot.  Their lunch bentos are also a good deal
author: Rhena G.

description:
Ordered tempera udon, edamame, shrimp tempura roll, chicken and beef combination 

Tempera udon- Broccoli, 2 shrimps, 1 yam, 1 carrot, 1 zucchini + some napa cabbage, spinach and shiitake mushrooms in the broth
Noodles and broth was good! Definitely enjoyed this!

Edamame- not much flavor

Shrimp tempura roll- the width was too big; taste alright

Beef+chicken combination- about $18 I thought that was way too pricy. Both meats were extremely dry as well. Not satisfied at all especially for it's price
author: Adrienne C.

description: Cute little place tucked up on the hill. Friendly staff but I was really disappointed when a lot of what they feature on their yelp profile is "outdated". I came here based on what they showed only to find out that they're under new ownership and don't honor those specials. -___- I didn't want to get up and leave so I just ordered. Staff 5/5.
author: Koa O.

description:
We went in right when they opened. The location is great. The food were delicious and we ended up ordering a second round. We ordered the rolls with the star on the menu and My fav had to be the la bamba roll. I was so tempted to order seconds. This place is definitely popular among FiDi office workers: the whole place was filled when we left. 

My advice: get the la bamba roll and get here when they open!!
author: Maggie L.

description: Quaint and cozy sushi place on Powell. Wonderful food! Great service! Bento boxes are amazing! I highly recommend! Great prices too!
author: Katie A.

description: I've been here a couple of times for lunch. They have some combinations which are nice since you get a few different things. The sushi here is not that great and I think the quality is lower than the prices indicate. Sanraku and Akiko's are nearby and offer much better quality sushi in around the same price range.
author: Sherry L.

description:
I went in and was greeted by both the waitress and the sushi chefs. It's a warm environment when it's not too busy. The servers do there best to meet everyone's request while serving everyone there food. I ordered Edemame and Tako Yaki, deep fried octopus balls, they are delicious I recommend this. for my meal I ordered the Katsu Curry because I am unable to eat pork I asked for chicken instead. I come frequently and one time I asked for udon noodles. it was delicious I basically was having curry udon. I recommend this place if you are looking for a nice place to hang out and enjoy your time during lunch. Dinner time is busy and can feel a bit rushed but it's a good time to hang out with friends as well. *They have Sapporo on tap!*

** I was concerened about the food safty notice so I asked a waitress abour it. The food safety notice is not updated, at the resturant they have the food departments updated form. They are safe and this site has not updated the notice.**
author: Jeanette Y.

description: Great food, reasonable price. Had bento box and 49ers roll. Both were excellent. The place is not big, clean and has good atmosphere. Service is fast and courteous.
author: Pavel H.

description:
I tried several different Japanese restaurants in San Francisco. This one is the best one by far and wide.

The foid tastes good. The place is ok, but the food is really good!
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Solid sushi spot!
The service isn't the best and the place is nothing special. However, I've never been disappointed by the food. 
Fresh, fast, and good prices. Definitely can't complain and will be back.
author: Angela C.

description:
I am surprised at the reviews here. I love sushi, and Japanese food in general... and Maru does a good job with it. I ate there twice in the week I was in San Francisco for business (it was just a couple of blocks from my hotel)

Chicken Teriyaki... good, maybe a trifle overcooked. Rice was excellent. Miso soup was a bit more salty than I used to... but it was good. the Maguro (Tuna) Sushi I had for a an appetizer was very fresh and delicious! Tea was basic green tea... but was good. Service was very good.

My second visit I had the Tempura.. and it was good, hot and crispy. Again the rice was good, tea was good... etc...  and then we get to one of my Favorite's! 

I ordered Toro Sashimi ( I love Toro (fatty Tuna belly), and seldom get it in Colorado). 

The bowl came with five nicely sized pieces... and they were FRESH! Probably some of the freshest Toro I have every had... and the flavor was delicious! Rich, almost buttery, and it just melted in your mouth. Toro is never cheap.. but good Toro is worth the expense. Maru made me very happy with the Toro they served.

I only give Five stars for truly exceptional food and service...  and few places get that from me. I will eat at Maru anytime I am in SF and hungry for good food!
author: Charlie G.

description:
This quaint spot on Powell is just a short walk away from tourist crowds but close enough to area hotels and attractions.  

I ordered sukiyaki and a customized dragon roll.  The sukiyaki was served in a generous portion and was mildly seasoned.  The roll was exceptional with very form and fresh tuna nod creatively made.  Service is prompt but not overly friendly.   That's not necessarily bad though.  I will revisit on my next trip and try more sushi.   The menu offers a broad range of great looking options and the display case clearly shows a stellar selection of fresh items.
author: Mike M.

description: Delicious, fresh, expertly handled fish. Beautifully flavored and textured rice (the heart of all superior sushi). Excellent service. reasonable prices. A pleasant enough environment, walking distance from several Nob Hill and Union Square hotels and concert, theater, and event venues. We shall return!
author: Michael D.

description: Amazing place. I ate here 3 times because the food is affordable, big portion, delicious and fast service. I stayed at the bar all the time for the sushi chef was nice and fun to watch making sushi. The ambiance was great and nice employees too
author: Bing M.

description:
I have walked by here probably a hundred times. Came here in the mid-afternoon for a quick bite. 

I looked in before entering to see if there was people in there. I don't want to be the only guests.... There was people! Yippie!

We go in and the waitress gives us a booth. I love the booth. Contrary to what the other people wrote I thought they have a wonderful selection of sushi rolls. Not a huge amount compared to other places but I felt it was enough. Give me too many options and I go crazy. 

I like how they have rolls that aren't mainstream. We ordered the O Yea! Roll, Crazy roll, and this baked roll.

Everything arrived pretty fast and I like the little personal plates you get. The sushi was good but not omg to die for but I wouldn't mind coming back. 

The service was friendly and prompt. Plenty of seating and the food is good. 

I saw a lot of people who are regulars who just come to get take out or to eat dinner by themselves. Comfortable seating.
author: Sarah C.

description: The sushi itself was pretty decent. Nothing to die for, but not terrible either. One of the only sushi places close to Union Square that doesn't have a wait. If you're a tourist, I recommend sitting near the windows as you can see the cable cars whizzing by. Service was pretty great. First time I've ever had my plate changed mid course at a sushi place. Would recommend it if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Taron G.

description: This was a great find for my husband and I searching for a sushi restaurant,  every roll was delicious! Dionysus, cherry blossom, dragon roll, powell roll. Nice people, great service. Glad to support this business! ! Great prices for the yummy rolls. Good quality, fresh! !! Enjoy! !!
author: Elaine U.

description:
I would give this place 5 stars if it weren't for the service! Everytime I go it seems like the servers can't be bothered, you have to keep calling them and reminding them
To bring your order. 
On another note I have been a loyal customer here for over 4 years, and the rolls here are sooo good especially the LA BAMBA ROLL!! It's spicy and tangy and delicious. Absolutely love it!!
author: Meher S.

description:
Great sushi and service. 
Sushi and oysters are fresh here. They got variety of drinks menu for sake and wine. It's two blocks away from union square.
author: Iris C.

description: Service isn't great, but the sushi is really solid. Their kawaii roll is fried yams & asparagus with mango on top, which is weird as hell but it works really well. The agedashi tofu isn't top notch either but the sushi is worth multiple visits.
author: Aaron M.

description: I wouldn't get the calamari. The other rolls I had I didn't enjoy but it could be I ordered poorly.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I had the sashimi deluxe for a reasonable slightly over $20.  Quality and service experience were good.  This was right on the cable car line and had a friendly vibe.  Convenient location.  Would recommend for meeting a group of friends or family gathering.
author: Dylan T.

description: Great sushi. However do not order the Tonkotsu ramen! Washed out flavors and over cooked store brought ramen. Hard boiled egg and dry pork.
author: Loz J.

description:
Sushi was amazing and fresh! For the location in this area the prices were super affordable! The servers were nice and the establishment INCLUDING the restrooms were clean!! Only reason I didn't give five stars is because the servers didn't check up as frequently as they should. 
PS - red bean tempura ice cream is surprisingly bomb!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Only one server during lunch time and she does cashier too...are you serious?

Imagine that...Slow service!

To top this all off, I specified no wasabi and guess what? It had wasabi. I asked them to change it but instead they just scraped off the wasabi. Really??? I can't eat wasabi and it literally makes my throat itchy/can't breathe.

Food isn't too bad but I wouldn't come here again.
author: Julie B C.

description: Quiet little sushi restaurant right off of Union Square. The miso soup with mushrooms was very good, but horribly overpriced for a tiny bowl. I also had a rainbow roll, which was delicious. Overall, everything was incredibly fresh, but service was slow and the food was too expensive.
author: Yuwei C.

description:
Food was okay. Just a decent sushi restaurant BUT the service was the worst. 

I came here with my bf on Thursday night. It was cold and i was craving udon so we decided to try this place which was very close to the union square. We were seated and it took 15minutes for a server to come by and get our drink orders. I told the server i wanted the tempura udon and she told me the udon soup ran out and no other soups are available for the night which made me very disappointed. I came into this restaurant just to order some soup and it ran out? So i had to order some sushi which was not bad. 
However, the waitress started bringing out foods that we didnt even order and kept trying to talk to us that we indeed ordered those foods. And she went back to the sushi chef and told what happened and she later came back and took the food back from our table. 

The Worst part is that another party sat down next to our table and they also ordered udon and the waitress took their order for TWO udons. What a nonsense. I called our waitress and told her what just happened and she said they never ordered udon. And 10 minutes later, their food came out which were two udon soups. This was not it. I also saw another table that came in after us and ordered udon and eating it. 
I was very upset and our waitress did not even give me an explanation for if.  

I still dont get what happened that night. 
Please find another sushi restaurant if you can! Food here is just OKAY and service SUCKS!!!!!!!!!
author: Jo K.

description: this is a review of the bento lunch box. it's a ton of food for the price (and given the area). it's decent quality. and if I'm ever stuck in this part of the city and need to grab a quick bite to go, I seem to end up swinging by Maru.
author: Mike V.

description: I don't know why people ordered later than us all got their orders but we were stilling waiting for ours...and the waitress got all the excuses that don't seem reasonable at all. Very bad service since we entered the restaurant, resulting in a very unpleasant dinner...
author: Theresa Y.

description:
Note to yourself : 
1. The menu on Yelp DOES NOT match the actual price Maru has in their place.
2. Toro IS expensive no matter where you go. Do not order it, if you do not know what it is. I know they have it up in daily special, but because it is like $20 for two pieces, they did not put the price up there.  
3. This is NOT authentic Japanese place.. obviously, it is Americanized LOL so if you want legit ones, go to $30+ per person place for REAL sushi
4. It's located on a slope, so you could see cable car going uphill or down hill .. pretty cool LOL 

Recommendation : 
1. Gyoza - so crispy and yummy 
2. Miso soup- always good, perfect amount of taste
3. Toro/ Uni /Fresh oyster - Tasted so fresh and good quality
4. Edamame- they actually steam, or boil it, unlike cheapy places where they just microwave the edamame.
5. Their deep fried ones- I noticed their oil is always clean. You could just tell it is clear and fresh. 

DO NOT GET : 
1. Chicken karage- it comes with katsu sauce.. wth lol and its pretty tiny size. Also taste wise... NOP .. just pass this. 
2. Fried rice- Please just do not get it lol, instead, try sushi.... i mean, this is SUSHI place lol
author: Yumi K.

description:
Blechh, mediocre sushi and horrible service.

The last time I went here is the LAST time I'll go here. First of all, you would think being in San Francisco would give you access to some of the freshest fish possible. Unfortunately, that is not the case at Maru. 

Their bigger problem is their service. I had to wait over 40 minutes for my food when there were only maybe 5 other tables ahead of me, all with no more than 2 people. I was forced to to ask them when my nigiri was coming (which with their quality, should have only take 2 minutes to make), and when it finally came out, they gave it to the wrong table. When the chef told the waitress her mistake, she had the audacity to take it from the other table, which already touched it, and give it to me. I had to ask her to remake it, at which point, she gave it back to the other table and told him it was "free."

Never again.
author: Sophia V.

description: The miso soup was excellent and the sushi was fresh and well prepared. I'll definitely be back.
author: Mike R.

description:
Got terrible food poisoning today after ordering tuna mango roll. Fish had some nasty bacteria... Never ever!!!!!
Please be aware!
author: Girl S.

description:
Hard to be less pleased. Over an hour waiting for a fried California roll that 2 different servers told us they were "checking on" and never came back. At the end, when we finally managed to request a check- we were told we got everything, with a laugh. I suppose if our food was not put in, then... Yes, we received it all. 

Nothing was amazing, or even above average. I don't recommend this place, sadly. As we were leaving- I heard another table saying they were missing drinks. The nice server said she'd "check on it." Good luck, my friend... You already received your entire order...
author: AC D.

description:
Terrible service. We arrived and sat down for 15 minutes before having to ask someone for water. The waitress didn't even notice we had been waiting and didn't seem to care when we asked to be served. 

The food was okay, not the best. I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Jenna B.

description:
I was pleased with the food, but not excited about coming back.  Since this place is in San Francisco, and has options for seafood freshness, the overall composition of the meals and flavors were nothing that was pulling me back in for a future visit.

My boyfriend and I ordered the "Lambaba" the "Volcano" and "Shrimp Tempura".  We also had a salmon hand roll and some edamame.

Out of the three rolls, I was only impressed with the Lambaba, while my boyfriend raved about the Volcano.  Shrimp Tempura was our safety net if we didn't like the other two.  The hand roll and the edamame were also great.

The service was ok, we had 2 waitresses which got confusing because we were asked the same question more than once...
author: Tiffany D.

description: For lunch the bento box is the way to go but don't expect to be blown out of the water. The salad was my favorite part of the meal. The service was mediocre as was the rest of the food.
author: Ashley J.

description: I think the sushi chef was actually Japanese!  We must have arrived just as they were opening for dinner because we were the only patrons.  Needless to say, service was quick and friendly. Food was very tasty.
author: Judy C.

description:
I wish we had read the Yelp reviews before we came.

They had incredibly bad service. We had four waitresses and not a single one knew what was going on while they switched off. The meals came out at different times, some before appetizers. They also ended up having to give half of my boyfriend's meal to go because they didn't realize they messed up the order. We didn't think to ask if it was coming because the timing was so off.

The only reason I'm giving two stars instead of one is because the udon noodle was great. However, the sushi left a lot to be desired and was poorly constructed.
author: Matthew O.

description: Absolutely horrible. Menus had different prices depending on which menu you were handed and liked. One menu said lunch combo for two items was 10.95 then she gave me a new menu saying it was now 11.95. I ordered my food and waited much longer than the 10 minutes I was told it would be. I asked for no salad and instead for extra rice as well. When she came out with my food she handed me the hot plastic container without a bag. I asked her for a bag and, with an attitude, the worker said she forgot to charge me for one as if that meant I wasn't allowed to pay for one after the fact. When I got to my office to eat the food, my sushi (California roll) was drenched in teriyaki sauce from the chicken. I wouldn't have cared for a simple mishap but as I got further into my meal they kept occurring. The salad I asked to be withheld seemed to have been put into the container on accident and then not thoroughly removed. The rice was placed on a few bits of salad and drenched in dressing. This is not to mention the sushi wasabi that was placed within the rice compartment (for the chicken) of the container. The chicken itself was tough and hard to swallow and the California roll was tasteless aside from teriyaki sauce they managed to get all over it. Do not eat here. My pet peeve is restaurants that try to play their customers especially though dishonest pricing. Definitely not worth it.
author: Sabrina A.

description: Bento Box at lunch for less than 12$.   Tasty, generous portion, and friendly staff.  What's not to like.  Will eat here again at very next opportunity.
author: Marty M.

description: I've been coming here for years and this is our sushi place when shopping in union square or downtown for it's affordability and consistent quality. The only complaint I've ever had was the wait staffs slight ineptitude. Otherwise, sushi quality is great, the rolls are wonderful and creative (especially the rainbow and romeo&juliet), and their quality is above average. Their prices are midrange and affordable. The only exception to the wait staff is Sylvia. She's old school, personable, and remembers our orders!
author: Sammy G.

description: A little expensive but so so good!!!!, finally a restaurant worth spending my calories on SF!!!
author: Runy K.

description:
Good service and friendly :) found this place by luck on 4th of July. I was shocked that they only have 3 stars because the fish was some of the freshest I've ever had and the rolls were perfectly made to enhance the fish without over crowding it with sauce or anything fried. Well done and we'll be back when we're in town! 

Recommendations:
Romeo and Juliet
Family affair
5 Blossom amazing!!!
author: Sunny J.

description: The service could improve a little bit, especially considering that there wasn't that many people there when I went. The portions on the box meals aren't as big as I thought but the food was very good. I would recommend stopping here if in the area but I wouldn't go out of your way. If you want top shelf stuff then go to Roka Akor but then pay double.
author: Jonah M.

description: Greeted warmly, food came in 5 minutes. Ordered two bento boxes, two items $9.50, affordable price. Salmon Terriyaki was freshly grilled, favorite item here. Beef Udon wasn't that great, but the texture of udon noodles was spot on.Miso soup was really nice, not too salty or bland, you could tell it wasn't store bought packets. 90's classics are played here, always makes me feel nostalgic. Located on a hill you could see the cable cars going down every 5 to 10 minutes, one of San Francisco's main attraction just 20 feet away while eating great Japanese food. Staff is really attentive filling your teas frequently. Always  coming back.
author: Nancy W.

description: The service was horrible. The waitress literally thrown everything in front of us when she did the cleaning.
author: Shuo T.

description: Terrible service - reordered a sushi roll that never came - and even the sushi rolls that came were only so-so.   Don't go to this restaurant.  The waitresses were not even friendly to even out the otherwise terrible customer service
author: Ethan W.

description: OMG! The food was ok. Okonomiyaki with pork was delicious. The teriyaki tofu, yakiniku and tempura was ok. I thought the teriyaki sauce on the tofu dish was over kill.
author: Laureen L.

description: After wandering around the neighborhood looking for lunch on a Saturday - I quickly discovered not a whole lot of Japanese restaurants open until 5 pm or 6 pm. Luckily I came across Maru - this was not my first choice but I'm happy I came in! The entire staff was extremely friendly and attentive which made the experience all the better. I ordered a Teriyaki bento with a california roll - dilish!
author: Mitsuyo M.

description: Terrific sushi house near Union square. Excellent atmosphere, excellent current music, and yes...terrific food!! Extremely fresh I found. Jinny and her staff provide excellent service with a smile
author: Ernie P.

description:
I am a big sushi snob, but i love this place!
i just decided to go after a yelp find, 
i must say, this place is just so awesome. sushi rolls are great and ramen, its great too. worth checking out.
author: Christine K.

description: Delicious!!  Chef made excellent recommendations and I was pleased with his selections. Only ordered sushi and it was fresh and melted in my mouth. Atmosphere clean and inviting. Service was impeccable.
author: Shauna G.

description: Oh man this place was awesome! They have a very wide selection of rolls (cooked, raw, vegetarian). I got the crazy roll and it was excellent. The prices are very reasonable for being in a pricey town like SF. I highly recommend this joint!
author: Bryan H.

description: Good service, excellent food. Omg! Been here twice during a week and it might be a third visit before I'm of to Norway again. Try the labamba for a delicious surprise!
author: Dominique H.

description: I really liked going here one afternoon. It was rainy and they seated us next to the window. I watched the cable cars all dressed up for Christmas go by out the window. The room was warm and cozy. The waitress was kind and efficient. We had a good Bento Box, very abundant and generous. I liked the rolls and Hamachi. My husband and I felt full after a modest amount of spending. The food was very tasty. I will go back there another rainy afternoon when I am in San Francisco.
author: Chris T.

description: Really good sushi, although can be horrifically expensive if you like toro, yellowfin or any of their specialties. Service is good at the sushi bar; haven't had table service. Sake selection is nice, again pricey, though. Start with a nicely grilled hamachi kama, a bit of your favorite sake and then decide how much you want the evening to cost.
author: Eric D.

description:
I ate here out of pure hunger...call this my 2nd lunch. 
Ordered a mixture of sashimi cuts, and left the selection up to the s-master.
He provided some generous cuts, and they were very fresh. This is a Korean-owned establishment, so bonus points there. Service was attentive and courteous. The '70s pop-light music could use a transformation though...
author: Derek N.

description:
---------TAKE OUT ONLY---------
Just like Derek N, I came here "out of pure hunger" after the restaurant we were trying to find was way further than we realized (damn you Google maps). 

FYI: The menu on Yelp IS WRONG! I should have known when the rainbow roll was only $6.95). Of course, I didn't realize this until I got there and realized my order was 2x more than I expected because I just believed the ridiculously low prices on Yelp. 

Anyway, the sushi is pretty decent. Not anything great but pretty consistent with all other sushi restaurants in the area. So, yes, for a lunch place when I only have 5 min left to eat, this place works.

Staff is friendly too.
author: Diana Y.

description: Really small cozy joint close to the Powell line. Sushi was very good and the prices were great too! Very nice staff and environment definitely worth the stop!
author: Doug W.

description: Sushi is great, as are the chefs they seem to be the only ones who care.  the atmosphere is pleasant and clean. The wait service is absolutely horrible.
author: Kevin L.

description: I ordered to go food & while waiting I asked for a cup of house tea, the server was kind enough to serve the tea but I noticed that a lipstick mark is still on the lid of the cup. I called  her attention  and I was given another cup of tea  but not sure if it was replaced with a new cup or lipsticks mark was just wiped away .Yuck !
author: Susan T.

description: This place is conveniently located near Union Square, but off the path a bit so not too busy. Good quality sushi at fair prices. We had a slew of cut rolls and a seaweed salad and everyone enjoyed them. The service was nice but slooooow.
author: Ian W.

description:
I came here with Sarah C. for lunch after walking by Sushi Toni and finding it closed.

The place was pretty empty around noon and the 3 of us were seated promptly. The menu isn't extensive but it still has all of the selections that you would normally find in a sushi place. I ordered the their 3 item bento box: grilled salmon, tuna roll and sashimi (tuna/salmon). The lunch special comes with rice, salad and miso soup. They also had their daily specials and raw oysters. I didn't give those a try but might do it next time around. The food arrived and I was very full after eating every last bite. I think I should have ordered one of their sushi rolls because my friend's volcano roll looked really good. 

The restaurant is not too far away from the office and easy to get to. I'll be back the next time I'm in the area.
author: Tim G.

description:
Charging up before a full day of shopping downtown.

The BEST miso soup I've had.  A+

Spicy Dragon Roll. A

The place felt authentic.  The sushi chef were Japanese, the server was Japanese.  Great ambiance for an early lunch in the city.
author: Pam S.

description: Really great sushi. Some of the best we've had. Dragon roll to die for. Good service and very clean. Good atmosphere. Recommend.
author: Rebecca W.

description:
Came here with friends. Nothing special- Fish is fine- not excellent, not super fishy. They serve nigiri cold instead of room temp-which reminds me of another sushi place I have to rate poorly

Over priced, and kind of smelled like pee in the corner we were in. I'm still waiting for an excellted $$ sushi place in SF- maybe I'm not finding because I'm waiting and not actively trying to find it. oh well. but Maru is not it.
author: Jessica P.

description: So good! We stayed in Union Square when friends came out from Texas so they could get the total tourist experience. While there we asked our bellman for a good sushi recommendation and he sent us here, being that we were in tourist mecca, I wasn't sure what to expect but the quality and authenticity was awesome! I highly recommend the Dragon, Crunchy and Kawaii rolls. I can't wait to come back and order again!
author: Claire M.

description:
I often have complaints about the attitude of the staff, but that wasn't the big service no-no at this decidedly average Japanese restaurant. The food was good and the staff were friendly.

What's my deal then?

Well, I ate here with my family, and our food was not delivered at the same time. Several dishes arrived at the table and had to be consumed before they went cold. We had to request for the rest to be sent, and by the time of their arrival, the first dishes had been finished off (I was ravenous, most likely).

How does that happen?

I can't help but assume that this is an infrequent occurrence, as the staff seemed genuinely surprised and apologetic. The food and service (otherwise) were decent enough to warrant a return trip, but hopefully next time our orders will arrive in a more timely and coherent manner.
author: Andrew Q.

description: On Powell St. Have a good Japanese restaurant  at romantic place. Great sushi and good selection of sake .
author: Kumsik M.

description:
The reviews were mixed and I figured what the heck, give Maru Sushi a try. I ordered sushi - your usual tuna and salmon, but also mackerel (Saba). All was very fresh and well cut. I also ordered the Crazy roll (tuna, salmon, cucumber, avocado, roe), which was also very good but could have been constructed slightly better as it was easy to fall apart when lifted with chopsticks. Note that I am a Midwesterner and found it all absolutely deliciously fresher than you find in the middle of the country. 

It was early and restaurant was empty other than me and one other single person at a table. The staff was pleasant and responsive. Prices were average.
author: Leian W.

description: My parents are picky with their food (they prefer Asian cuisine) so I had to take them here twice the same weekend due to its convenient location near our hotel and the lack of having to wait compared to other places in SF. I like the atmosphere here and the nice view of the cable cars and people walking up the hill, but the two times I went the food was only alright - it did the job but was ultimately forgettable. The sushi was pretty decent although lacking something extra and the katsu curry could have definitely been better. Service was friendly although a little slow at times with getting food out and giving us the bills. All in all, the place will serve your purpose if you're looking for a quick Japanese food fix when you're in Union Square. However, beyond convenience and warm food there's not much else. But that's probably its selling point.
author: Tony H.

description:
Pretty good! On a mission to try most (if not all) sushi places near union square so
I stopped by. Though, my only complaint was with the rice. It shouldn't have been as hard as it was. Had the lion king and the king crab (think think thats the name) but besides that it was satisfying. Fast service, friendly workers, and fitting decor.
author: Joselyn G.

description: We stopped by this place on our way out of town. It's conveniently located near union square.  I was pleasantly surprised with the nice atmosphere, friendly service, and delicious food.  We shared a lunch special for $11.95 that included soup, salad, rice and a choice of three items. We picked tempura, spicy tuna roll, and gyoza. It was really good food at a reasonable price!
author: Amanda F.

description: Wonderful sushi bar! The location is very cozy and clean. The decoration is a modern oriental style and they play great pop music. We had miso soup, the swamp roll and the dragon roll. It only took them less than 10 min. to make it and it was delicious! The waitresses were very attentive and delivered great customer service! All in all I was a very happy customer! :)
author: Soraya F.

description:
We ordered the udon & it was not authentic. Same for the Gyoza. 

Service was sub-par. Our water glasses were never refilled the entire time we were at the restaurant. 

I definitely won't be eating here again when I'm looking for good Japanese food.
author: Maura A.

description:
I'm a little weirded out abt the negative reviews and suspect some of them may be fraudulent. When reading these reviews, I think it's important to take a look and see how many friends and reviews are associated w the accounts.  My account has no pic, so you'd wanna take stuff like that into account when judging the veracity of various reviews.  

I've had great service and terrific sushi here.  Their salmon skin roll, salmon skin salad, and salmon skin hand roll are outstanding as is their chirashi.  The chef has always been flexible w me.  Also they have gluten free soy sauce and gluten free unagi sauce.  I bring clients here a lot and everyone seems to love it.  If you're in a hurry tell them ahead of time.  Ppl love the miso soup.  The seaweed salad is terrific and made gluten free.  They have also sake toro (salmon belly, it's inSANE!!!), hamachi toro (yellowtail belly, also amazing), I've not had the tempura cause it's got gluten but my piano player loves it.  They have excellent hot and cold sakes plus  an excellent and hard to find beer Koshihikare Echigo.  Which is supposedly made with all rice.  It's not listed as gf but I don't get sick off of it.  I don't dig on fancy rolls but the Cherry Blossom is great.  

Ask for sushi chef Kamui, he's the elder and will tell you what's especially good.
author: L. E.

description:
I'm surprised by how little care went into making the food. The free miso soup tastes like somebody washed their feet in it. The california roll I had must have been made before hand, because I got it only 30 seconds after I ordered it. Finally, the seafood udon is an absolute disaster. The soup had no flavor. And the so called "seafood" are just small bits of calamaris and  clams left over from making sushi. And they charge $10 for it. 

Don't let them fool you that this is a Japanese restaurant. All the people who work there speak in Korean. Most of them probably never had genuine Japanese food in their entire life. My guess is that the only reason they chose to open a Japanese restaurant is that a. Japanese food is more popular than Korean food, and b. Japanese food is normally more expansive than Korean food.
author: Dylan L.

description: All I can say is walk a block over and eat at Mikaku! Same price and so much better. I would align Maru with grocery store sushi. The tempura veggies were rubbery, Goya seemed very store bought and the rolls were complicated but boring in flavor.
author: Torry H.

description:
Food: The sushi really wasn't all that good. Not that it was bad. Just.. whatever. I got the cherry blossom and my boyfriend got the baked alaska, i believe. There are a lot of sushi restaurants in this area so they should probably step up their game if they want to compete. 

Service: Was good. Very nice.

Location: It's ideal because it's so close to Union square. (That's why my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try)

Parking: You can always park at the Union Square parking lot. Otherwise good luck finding street parking. My boyfriend and I actually took the trolley from around Ghirardelli Square all the way down to Union Square. (It's probably a little easier to find parking around Ghirardelli Square).
author: Emily Y.

description: Stopped in here randomly for a quick bite, and not like I was really expecting a whole lot from a conveyor belt sushi spot, but I thought they would at least have some basic sushi out in circulation. Maybe it was because they were about to close, but they had NOTHING but half rolls. The reason why I gave 2 stars was because the sushi chef was really nice, and so was the server.
author: Emy s.

description:
Sushi not fresh ... Went to emergency n diagnose food poisoning . N have 102.8 fever . 
I don't care if Korean or Japanese own the place , chef should know better ! 

All the sf residents or ppl want to get quick sushi please check on yelp before u get there !
author: Karina T.

description:
I don't even know where to begin. 
Got seated quickly. Then waited for about 10 minutes. No water, no waitress. Nothing. I had to call the waitress and she was agreeable, but no apology for making us wait. We gave her our order, including the drinks and then she disappeared for another 10 minutes. The food s.l.o.w.l.y came out, one order at a time. She forgot our forks, small dishes for soy sauce and plates for the appetizers. Oh wait... The appetizer came after the dinner was served. In fact, I had to remind her that she never gave us our miso soup and salads.... AFTER the main courses were served. The tonkatsu was so-so. But the udon was good.
author: m k.

description: We come here every time we come to San Francisco!  Love the food and atmosphere.
author: Jerry S.

description: The sushi was good but the service wasn't the best. I came with co workers for a lunch meeting but as the lunch service went on you could tell that the one waitress they have is stretched thin. She is very friendly and does a good job under the circumstances. I would come early to avoid a long wait to have your order taken. It didn't happen to us but I think some of the people who came after us when it got busy had to wait a while. Good sushi though!!!
author: Sergio L.

description: This place was DISGUSTING!!!!! It took them 15 minutes to take our order,  then arrived with waters and their sliced lemons had MOLD all over it. It had been moldy for MONTHS. We brought it to all of the servers attentions and they Didn't Care at all !!! No one cared. This place is dirty and should be investigated immediately! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
(See pics)

Came back for some noodle soup since we can't stand the wait at Katana-Ya. The seafood udon was basic and the spicy tuna roll was good. But nothing to write home about.

Probably should stick with the sushi next time at this place.
author: T L.

description: Very bad service. The lady's attention span was the worst. Sat us, walked away, asked it we wanted anything to start and before we ordered she walked away. Then in the middle of us ordering our food she walked away to seat another table then went and waited on other tables. The worst ever.
author: Eric D.

description: We went late evening and had great service.  The only thing better than the service was the sushi.  Awesome rolls and the flavored all blend well. Good quality fish has well.
author: L S.

description: Mediocre Japanese, same menu as every other "recommendable" Japanese sushiya, and nothing with the food to distinguish itself from the pack. I had Uni (sea urchin roe) for the first time ever, and I appreciated it as the very "foodie" moment that it was. Uni is awesome. Sadly, this restaurant is not.
author: Cesar G.

description: Always tasty, always friendly. I've been here a few times with friends. Have tried the sushi, ramen, and udon. All were really good and the service is very friendly. A go to if I'm in the area.
author: Meeshers S.

description: I had the opportunity to stop by for lunch.  I ordered a bento box and the spicy tuna was actually very good.  The salad, rice and teriyaki were good - nothing special or different than can be ordered anywhere.  The really sad part was the service.  The service was so slow, drinks never arrived, wasabi never arrived and getting the check was beyond difficult. I cannot say I would be back any time soon.
author: Bailey K.

description: This place is my familys go to spot for affordable japanese food.  The sashimi and sushi are always fresh and the cooked food is solid.  They have an extensive menu of special sushi rolls and their hamachi kama is bomb!!! We always order it. Service is nice and friendly.
author: Richard T.

description: I had dinner in this restaurant for a party of 8. We ordered appetizers (gyoza and thuna/salmon salads) and about 20 different rolls. The food was good but nothing out of the ordinary and made me eager to return. The service was ok but a little bit slow.
author: Thibaut L.

description:
Service is slow even when it's empty.

Boo. Mediocre food. But what gets me is the rudeness of one of the waitresses there. I was so unimpressed by the service there that I am inspired to write a long, unhappy run-on sentence.

I know it was lunch crush (restaurant half full, but seemed like quite a few to-go orders), but if someone specifically says, "I know you're busy, but we are really, really in a hurry and anything you can do would help," you don't act huffy and then completely ignore the patrons for 35 minutes on a simple bento box order until they have to ask a second waitress to check on their order, which she brings it out immediately, indicating that it probably sat there under the heat lamp or warmer for a while before getting to you.

Ok, ok. I exaggerate. She didn't completely ignore us for 35 minutes. Every now and then she would shoot me evil eyes and then ignore me. 

Because I don't want to let one waitress who maybe had a bad day earn one star for food that probably is worth 2.5-3, i'll still give them 2 stars.
author: Jess C.

description:
There was nothing fancy or hugely different from this sushi joint to any average sushi joint. We went on a weekday late, around 9pm and it was slow, as expected, only couple other tables. 

The choices were good, more than I expected, a few new items of rolls I had never heard but eagerly ordered. The potato bug was really amazing, made with unagi and would love to see this offered back at home in AZ!

Although I'm vacationing here and want to try new places, I probably won't come back unless I have a good sushi craving and then a second visit may be in store!
author: Nicole N.

description: I wasnt going to come here since it wasnt 4+ stars but I did . I blasted in my pants when I tried the fried california roll. The shrimp tampora was great post-jizz relief that made me nice , relaxed and ready for rest of my day
author: Sandwich D.

description: Great sushi! The Rolls are amazing. I recommend the Cherry Blossom hands down! Its very cozy and the food is well prepared. They take a while to come with the menus but it is definitely worth the wait!
author: Carlos C.

description: I asked my boyfriend how he liked his ramen and he replied, "Top ramen has more flavor than this." We also had a few rolls...the food court sushi place back home had better tasting and better made rolls than this place.
author: Jenny L.

description: Nothing fancy. Quiet, clean, courteous service, reasonably priced, good food. Will definitely come back again.
author: Liran T.

description:
This place was just ok. It was clean and the service was good but the food was a little bland and kind of odd tasting. The yakiniku was fruity (?) and the vegetables in the yaki soba were steamed and soft. 
The Go-Go roll was tasty.
author: K. H.

description:
Surprisingly good and affordable sushi in the union square area. The 4 of us had  4 rolls, 3 orders of nigiri, deluxe sashimi, agedashi tofu all for $120 including tax and tip. 
The rolls were fresh n good and there wasn't a wait on a Saturday night. Score!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Went here for a quick bite when I was in SF on business.  Got in just before they closed but they were still happy to welcome me in.  No frills, authentic sushi place with great staff.  The sushi was fantastic.  Rice slightly warm, fish fresh and basically melting in your mouth.  A small hole in the wall, underrated little gem in SF
author: Jeff P.

description:
Pretty good sushi. Great people watching as the cable car runs right in front of it. Friendly staff. Also located right by our hotel.

We had a great time there and the experience was worth some more stars.
author: Leah G.

description:
No, it's not amazing or high-caliber or innovative or cutting-edge, but Maru Sushi has been in the business since . . ? A very long time, at the least, I can say. They serve up quality sushi and do very cute bento-style dinner trays with wee lil' pickled veggies which are, to me, a hallmark of good yet humble Japanese cooking.

If you want innovative, visit Blowfish, Kyo-ya, or elsewhere, but Maru has a great location if you're in the Union Square area. I used to live on Pine Street and this was perfect to dodge into for a simple dinner. I never had fish here that seemed old or otherwise substandard, but it's true that they don't go far out on a limb in terms of innovation.
author: Mike W.

description:
Bad, bad, bad service, food just ok. Avacado in avacado roll was way too ripe, felt like guacomole in a roll! 
We picked up take out and paid with Credit Card and she forgot to add the 10 cents for the bag and we didn't have any cash or change with us and after we waited over 25 minutes for our food she rudely asked us for 10 cents in change before she would give us our food. When we explained we only had credit card she argued with us for a few minutes before another woman came out saying she already charged us 10 cents with our order. I would have been fine not getting a bag but we had 3 orders of bento boxes and 3 soups with sauce and napkins etc.
If that wasn't irritating enough, we got back to our office and noticed there was food missing from the bento boxes. Since it took so long to get our food and argue about 10 cents we didn't have time to go back anyways. I did call them to inform them of the missing food and she put me on hold to make sure we paid for what was missing. Once she realized I was telling the truth she rudely told me to "come get it."
author: M M.

description:
This place is down the street from our hotel. We came here twice during our 4-day stay. First time we got combination platter with tonkatsu and salmon teriyaki. Portion was decent. But the second time we came during lunch and got a bento box with chicken teriyaki and saba. This time it's such a bargain - for $10 you get rice, salad, soup, and generous amount of food. If I lived around here I would certainly become a regular! (We're actually already regulars but for just 4 days). Staff are also very friendly. 

Ps. We didn't have sushi at all. Maybe the place does a better job with entrees.

Ps 2. My friend who's so fussy about Asian food she almost makes every travel companion hate her LOVES the miso soup here
author: Toey S.

description: Stop by to have dinner today.  What a disappointment and it was on the pricey side.  I ordered Poki & Yaki Udon.  The Poki was over sauce and so was the Yaki Udon.  The udon was over cooked , very saucy, and over seasoned with a weird taste.  Would not recommend and not go back.  Go elsewhere!
author: Michele L.

description:
A cute sushi house located close to Union Square.  The inside is very clean and has a quiet ambiance.  

As a visitor from San Diego, I wanted to see how San Francisco's sushi would compare.  However, I guess that was a bad idea at 2:30pm because almost every sushi bar was closed until 5pm! Maru Sushi was the only place that was open.. so off we went.

I ordered the sushi combo (5 nigiri/6 piece roll) which wasn't a bad deal since it came with a small salad and miso soup.  But...

Service was very poor.  She didn't even ask for our drinks until she saw our menus tucked away, and then came over for our food order.  It wasn't very busy either - only 2 other parties in the place.  I ordered a spicy tuna roll instead of the standard California roll (additional fee), but received the California roll anyway.  Whatever, I didn't feel like sending it all back.  They didn't charge the extra fee, thankfully.

The quality of the sushi was okay.  Nothing special, but it was fresh.

I will definitely be visiting other sushi bars if I visit San Francisco again.
author: Lindsay S.

description: We came here after Sushi Toni was too packed and we needed a sushi fix. This place is never crowded, so that says something about how good people think it is. The food isn't that bad, and without having to wait, it's probably worth it.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Food: Rolls were good, nothing amazing.

Ambiance: Cool looking on the outside, simple and clean inside.

Service: Decent, the waitress forgot one of our rolls.

Price: Not cheap, not too expensive, right in the middle.

Overall: Good sushi close to Union Square and a short walk up Powell towards Nob Hill.
author: Binh D.

description:
We came here on directions from a local, said he ate here all the time! My wife (being Japanese) asked about it's authenticity and the man who offered the suggestion said he thought it was authentic.

Although the food was pretty good, my wife was not impressed. It was just OK. Service was good, food was good, but nothing about this place blew our socks off.

Way to many places in San Fran to make this a regular spot when we are in town!

Sláinte!
author: George P.

description:
Delicious sushi, great soup, good sake, absolutely interplanetary service.  

Bizarre, service by the waitress.  

Reasonable cost.  If you don't care about being ignored, then eat here.
author: Bill E.

description: I stopped in while visiting union square today since I had been here once before but cant remember for the life of me if I liked it. I decided to get some Temaki and nigiri instead of Rolls which is what I normally get. the service was great the food came out promptly and most importantly the fish was very fresh. I plan to come back sometime in the near future and check out the Rolls and I will revise my review then. For now though I dont believe this place deserves only 3 stars :-(
author: Megan W.

description: I am a regular at this restaurant mostly because it is convenient for me to pop in on my way home from work. I can honestly say that after 3 years of dining here- I feel right at home. All the chefs know my name, order and are just great conversationalists when posted up at the sushi bar grabbing a quick bite. I even moved away for 7 months and upon my first visit back, they still remembered my order and even suggested a few new rolls. The service can be a bit slow at times but honestly, if your looking to enjoy quality sushi with a relaxing ambiance- what's the rush? If you haven't been to Maru or at least ordered take out, your missing out!
author: Lauren H.

description: Probably just as good as any other Japanese restaurant in this neighborhood. Not bad at all. For what it's worth, the miso soup was the best I've ever tasted -- but that's not enough to set it apart. Food was very fresh. Although my gyoza was perfectly prepared, it didn't come with sauce and the server didn't return until after I finished eating so I didn't bother to ask her for some. Also, my maki roll was a little sloppy. I don't understand their hurry, I was the first customer in there. Still, a very good lunch.
author: Angie V.

description: The lunch special is really affordable. This place offers some inventive rolls, but it's a pretty classic japanese place which is nice in this day and age of hip trendy stuff.
author: Mark S.

description: Good food. Good prompt service. Reasonably priced lunch specials including bento boxes.
author: Serge S.

description:
Overpriced.
Tasteless.
Stingy.
Slow.
...bad service.
author: Juju S.

description: We had a sample platter of sashimi and it was nothing short of impressive.  The staff was also very nice.
author: Cash M.

description: Trying this place for the first time in five years of visiting San Francisco.  Restaurant is full of patrons, so this looks promising.  Wife started with uni and tobiko nigiri sushi.  She said the uni and tobiko were both fresh, and the rice to uni/tobiko ratio were adequate.  We both ordered the tonkotsu ramen, and found it to be meh...One reason was the noodles were really over cooked and mushy.  The broth had flavor, but was lacking something...not sure what it was, but it just lacked that umami thing.  Additionally, they had an overcooked boiled egg sitting in the broth which could have influenced the slight sulfer flavor in the broth.  Along with the tonkotsu I had an order of deep fried oysters.  Nothing special. Wish they hit it with some salt after it came out of the fryer.  Was cooked OK, served with a lemon wedge and katsu sauce.  I then noticed they had specials of monk fish liver and kampachi nigiri.  Both sushi were excellent, and again had decent product to rice ratios.  The service was kind of slow at first, but the waitresses did warm up.  The dishes did come out slow, but the place was being slammed on a Christmas night dinner.  Overall not bad.  Stick with the sushi items and everything should be fine.
author: Trevor A.

description: Ate here twice, for lunch and dinner, since it was around the corner from the conference site -- perhaps because I'm living now in NC, but I thought it was good -- maybe not stellar--I'd give it 3.5 stars for the food but unlike others, found the service to be really good, so have bumped them up to 4.  Shared a series of rolls -- both raw and cooked, with friends and also had miso, tempura, and grilled hamachi -- everything was tasty and I'd go back if I were again in the area.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I have been to Maru Sushi a handful of times and the sushi rolls have always been good. I thought it was decently priced and I have never had a bad experience here.
author: Amanda O.

description: Really awesome service . The 49er roll is the perfect balance of Lemon and salmon. Also has a great selection of vegetarian sushi. Really convenient location by union square shopping
author: Elizabeth B.

description: a few weeks ago my lover and I were looking for a a place for us to eat, and I had a taste for Chinese food, and we stumbled across this place, and sushi sounded awesome. This place was cute, and quaint, and looked clean. So we ordered a few rolls, and they were pretty good, just a little fishy tasting. After leaving, I came home, and laid down for a bit, and after a few hours my stomach started hurting. Thinking nothing of it, I went about my day, towards the end of the evening, I was projectile vomiting, and this went on for 3 days, I couldn't hold down any food, or liquids. My lover got the same food poisoning sickness shortly after me... I haven't been out for sushi since... that place make my stomach churn every time i think about it..
author: Shai W.

description: Still eating, good place good service and GREAT MUSIC. Like forest says "that's all I have to say about that".
author: Chris A.

description: For sushi places near Union Square -- this one is pretty good.  I actually really enjoy the interior design of this restaurant -- lends to some authenticity.  Some minuses: there were definitely a few lingering gnats wafting around the restaurant -- never adds to an enjoyable dining experience.  The temperature of my sushi was a little less than cold (personal preference).  Otherwise, not a bad spot to grab sushi downtown.
author: Mel G.

description:
I have a friend who is obsessed with this place, so I came here with her for some Udon.  I've never had Udon before, and I love Pho, so I figured it had to be kind of the same.  

Well, I'm obviously a dumb white girl thinking that all Asian noodle soups might taste the same, because the Udon was totally not for me.  The big fat noodles tasted like chemicals and grease, and the broth was too bland.  There was a large slice of pink imitation something in there, which I did not eat, and large shitake mushroom pieces, which I also did not eat.  The only thing that I actually ate was the Tempura that came on top of it.  So either I hate Udon, or Maru Sushi's Udon was terrible.  I wish I knew!
author: Rachelle P.

description: This was our first stop on our trip to San Fran. It was very good and the service was great. The girls are always running around clearing plates and refilling water. It was a bit pricey for us though. Maybe we just ordered too much, but our bill was 70$ for 2 and we didn't even get full. The Calamari was the absolute best we have ever had!!!! Wow. It seemed worth the price since it was so good. Maybe we weren't prepared for CA prices either, but this was one of our more expensive meals we had on our trip. It was great!
author: Kerri S.

description: This place was a disappointment. Ordered a bento box with Gyoza ( Fried in old oil, barely any filling inside), California Roll (too much rice), the only thing that was good was the side of salad. It's not inexpensive so why even go here?
author: J. C.

description: Great sushi for the price.
author: Tammie B.

description:
Some of the freshest sushi I have seen around.  The Toro was delicious, sake belly awesome!  

The Sushi chef turned me on to several items which were all delicious!! He even made his own sushi knife!! What dedication!!

Would definitely go back again next time I'm in S.F.
author: brandon e.

description: We had all sushi! fresh, delicious sushi, and it was amazing! We got hamachi, hamachi toro, tai and a form of hirame. Emi prepared them to perfection, including the 49er roll we decided to order later. Sooo good! I can't wait to make this my fave sushi hangout! Next time we come we hope Emi and Buta/Puta ( he said it so fast ) will remember us as the crazy kids who got a looooot of sushi :) highly highly recommend! Oh and get got sake too!
author: Anca R.

description:
I've gone to Maru Sushi mostly because of its convenient proximity to Union Square, but I have never been amazed by their food. I've tried the Seafood Udon and a few of their specialty rolls and was pretty underwhelmed. My friend ordered the Chicken Katsu and didn't even want to finish it because the entire dish just tasted so bland. 

In terms of their service, it's pretty hit or miss. Sometimes the servers are extremely sweet and attentive, but there have been times where my friends and I just sat in our chairs, regretting ever having walked in the door. There was an occasion where the server threw our checks at us immediately after we had gotten our food and asked us, "Could you stop eating and pay now?" It wasn't even close to closing time! 

All in all, the food is pretty standard. Nothing to tweet about. I'd only come here again if my friends really, really wanted to and I was hungry enough to comply.
author: Michelle L.

description: I love this place! Try the kawaii roll (vegetarian) it is excellent! Definitely a place to cone if you like sushi!
author: Mena T.

description:
Been to this place 3 times, and 2 out of 3 they messed up the order.  

Friend ordered a lunch combo with gyoza to go, and when we got back no gyoza.  Today another friend ordered a lunch combo with the salmon teriyaki, and she got chicken teriyaki instead.  The older lady kept insisting to my friend that she was wrong and that she had ordered chicken teriyaki.  I didn't understand why she wouldn't just replace the order.  

The food is average.  Nothing really special, and the service is inconsistent.
author: Young K.

description: We were excited about Japanese Good as we lived in Japan.  Service was ok. Curry was good, Sushi was good, Okonomiyaki was not good, they were out of Ramen (after we ordered and 5 minutes later was told no Ramen) and Nabi which we had ordered was not delivered so we asked and finally after another 10 minutes we got Nabi.  Overall, not a great experience but....we also had high standards after living in Japan
author: Bart F.

description: Just off Union Square.  Great value.  Had lunch special Bento Box.  Terrific Ahi Tuna.  Tempura was very good
author: Jim M.

description:
We will never go eat at this place again...

The food was ok, but the SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE!!!!!

I'm in town visiting my mom with my 14 months old. 
We just went for lunch around 12:30. Were seated right away. Everything was ok at the begining. We ordered 5pc yellowtail, agedashi tofu and a 3 item bento box. 

The sashimi came right away, the tofu took a while that I almost forgot we ordered it. The server NEVER came to check if everything was ok. We needed more tea and water, but I had to wait and finally flag someone down to ask for a glass of water. Our server only came by to take our order and drop off the yellowtail, she didn't seem happy to be at work, maybe she was having a bad day... (shrug, I used to wait tables, I would at least be nice to my customers even if I wasn't feeling it.)

The bill was $28 something, so mom put down $30. She didn't even give her back the change and assumed that was her tips. And when my mom asked for a copy of the reciept, the server gave us this stink face. Well, if you want a nice tip, give better service! 
Oh, and they never thanked us for our business...
author: Sway M.

description:
Walking around SF last week to entertain myself while the fiance was at work and I decided I needed to have sushi! I was limited to walking distance but from Union Square that's not really too tall of an order. So I scoped through the reviews (I can't go anywhere without Yelping!) and had my mind made up on Sushi Toni because it was supposed to be open till 3 for lunch. I struggled up the dang hill and got there at 2pm only to discover them very closed. Sigh. I'd passed Maru on the way there so on the way back my stomach couldn't take it anymore and I went for it. 

I'm so glad I did! I had the Bay Scallop Roll & the Crunchy Roll (I think). In any event it was all really delicious and the service was on par. Given that it wasn't that crowded I suppose it wasn't too tall of an order. I really enjoyed that the Crunchy Roll easily broke apart if you will so that I could eat it in two bites and not look like a pelican stuffing my beak with too big of bites. 

I really enjoyed my indulgent lunch - it wasn't very cheap - I think around $26 with tip for just the two rolls (and water) but I found it very delicious which given that it was a last minute non-Yelp consulted stop I left happy and full!
author: Erin H.

description:
I  extremely surprised that the reviews were so poor for this place! I was with a group of four and we were seated very quickly, it took about 10 min to get our miso, salad, and tea even though it was during the lunch rush hour. 

I saw that this place got a lot of one star reviews so I asked the manager what was up. The manager, a really sweet soft spoken lady, told me she just purchased the restaurant last year but the reviews were from more than 3 years before she owned the company. I double checked and she was right, they are getting horrible reviews that are affecting the decisions of those who want amazing sushi just a short walk from Union Square. Give it a shot, don't let these crap reviews sway and deprive you from this jewel of a place.
author: Thomas C.

description: I ordered a lunch combination of Salmon Teriyaki & Tempura Combo to go. The salmon teriyaki was about 1/3 the size of my palm, it was pathetic. The tempura combo included one piece of shrimp tempura, 2 carrots (who likes those anyways?), & a broccoli. The miso soup was alright and as for the salad, it was nothing special at all. At the end, my stomach did not settle very well and it was a bad experience. All that for $11, bleh.
author: Kawai N.

description:
Okay so here's the deal...NO BUENO!

So my friend and I  were seated promptly, great customer service and the place was well kept and clean. YAY a star for you!

Here's were it all fell apart...Our orders were taken and we waited the average time to get our drinks...my friend orders some veggies, veggie tempura roll, tofu salad and miso soup, I get miso soup, amaebi and a shrimp/eel/avo/tobiko (golf) roll...so the wait begins

15 mins goes by...and we joke around...I guess they went to the wharf to get some fresh shrimp, laugh it off...

20 mins later we get our miso and my friend gets her tofu salad
The miso soup. NO BUENO! WAAAAY TOO SALTY, I had to wait till it cooled, slurped it half way then added my tea to balance the salt ratio.

on the 50 min mark my friend gets her veggie tempura roll and says I won't finish till you get yours, so I was like...oh okay

at the 1 hour mark I finally get my amaebi and "golf roll"...and I'm thinking THIS BETTER BE GOOD...

so the amaebi...nice size....I tried it, Ummmmmmm THIS IS NOT SWEET on top of that I didn't even get the head deep fried in tempura.
The "golf roll" it was o.k. but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it again, plus they forgot the tobiko.

My friend tries to give a kicker and says, well at least the ginger tastes good. 

So fans of SUSHI, THIS IS NOT THE BUSINESS!
author: Edrian D.

description: Possibly the best sushi I've ever eaten. We stumbled upon this place on our way to eat at a different restaurant on a holiday trip to San Francisco. So glad we stopped in and changed plans. Great food and great atmosphere. Kid friendly but not super loud. Nice ambiance and great holiday music playing. So much fun.
author: Scotland R.

description:
Id give it 10 stars if I could.  This spot is my newest addition to the top five best sushi restaurants in the country. Behind only Morimoto's in NYC and Mashikos in West Seattle (http://sushiwhore.com/).  Maru has great roll combinations and a steady flow of saki if you like.  The fish is of course the very freshest and much of it bought locally.  I have tried nearly their entire menu now in the two times I've been there, but that doesn't mean it's a short menu.  On the contrary, I was with several big eaters each time i went.  You must try the yummy yummy roll, the Romeo and Juliet, and the swamp roll.  the 79er and 49er were excellent too! 
I love this place.  It is a must eat whenever I am in San Fran!
author: L L.

description:
Good food, specially noodles!! hmm, yummy!!
Friendly service, convenient location...
Will be back for sure!!
author: Min Kyung C.

description:
This place is alright.  Considering it's right smack dab in the middle of touristy Union Square, it could be way way worse.   You can almost always get seated right away - there was no crowd at all during the lunch hour yesterday, although it can get a little packed around dinner time.  Their pricing is average - I think the 3-item Bento boxes ($11) are a pretty good deal (although they fry instead of steam their gyoza, which is annoying).  The sushi is fresh and tastes great and they have a decent selection of rolls and specials each day.

The service has always been somewhere between a 6 and 8 (with 10 being amazing), depending on what time of day I've stopped by.  If you sit at the bar, the sushi chefs are pretty nice guys - they'll chat you up and accomodate any special requests.  At lunch yesterday I was reminded that like most sushi places, they don't have a bar.  Pretty sure their only alcohol selections were sake and plum wine - no thanks. 

This is a good little restaurant.  I wouldn't go out of my way to get here, but if you find yourself near Union Square and craving some sushi, Maru is a good option.
author: Kristen W.

description:
For a long time I was curious about this restaurant just because it stands out in a middle of one of the steep blocks of Powell Street where the cable cars climb up.  This evening sushi was one of my choices and being near Union Square I decided to finally visit it.

First it was a good sign that more than half the tables were occupied.  I chose to sit at a table over sitting at the sushi bar.  I went for the regular sashimi combo, which is 12 pieces which this evening consisted 3 each tuna, albacore, salmon, and white tuna.  I was disappointed yellowtail was not included.  Otherwise the fish tasted good and fresh.

I may try some of the other Japanese restaurants nearby, in particular on Bush Street nearby, next time I want to check out a Japanese restaurant in this area.
author: H K.

description:
Sorry...it was awful, but not the worst sushi I have had in San Francisco. That honor goes to Steve Fuji's place at Ebisu, which is horrific.
Anyway, this quality is blah, sort of just like eating cardboard on rice.
Also the place reeks..needs a major reno.
author: Kenn P.

description: Typical Japanese decor. Not too busy for a Saturday. We were very hungry so ordered sushi rolls and combination plates. The salad and miso soup was ok, nothing to write home about. Thr rolls were fresh and just like any other sushi place. The teriyaki salmon was average and the chicken was maybe a B+. Service was surprisingly lacking since it was not busy, only 2 other tables so why did it take so long for more tea? On our next visit to SF we will try another place because I know there are better places out there.
author: Roxy L.

description: Went here for lunch since it was right around the corner from the hotel we were staying at. Ordered 2 rolls and 2 beers. The food was good, the service was decent and the price was right, Bob.
author: Laura H.

description:
We came to San Francisco for the Marathon Weekend.  We were referred to a sushi place down the block from this place, but they needed reservations and looked to only seat about 10 people so we walked here and decided to give it a try.

The Service was really great. Although they missed a water at the table, I felt this was really trivial due to the quality of the food, and the attentiveness of the server. 

The food was not extraordinary, but it was relatively good compared to the sushi places out in Pleasant Hill we have been to.

If in the area we will definitely be back.
author: Dean M.

description:
Just dropped in with three friends. Had Oshinko appetizer which was great, others had rolls they loved, I had the Spicy Yosenable which was supurb.

However, the most impressive thing was the service. The waitresses would silently slide by, pick up old dishes etc and never interrupt our conversation. Once, in the middle of a story, I dropped a chop stick. The waitress slid by, picked it up, picked my other one up, and gave me a new set efficiently and silently. 

I was just so happy to not have been interrupted ("Sir, would you like a new set?, etc). Very impressive!!! (and unfortunately all too uncommon :-( )
author: David H.

description: I always crave mix tempura and this place has the best mix tempura by far and it was so worth it. I seriously got like 6 shrimp tempura and hella vegetable tempura compared to other restaurants that only give 2 shrimp tempura and little vegetables. If I'm craving sushi when I'm downtown, this is the place i would go to
author: Janice V.

description:
The food was okay, not horrible but not on par with most of what I ate in San Francisco on my trip in early March. Service was average. 

Don't. Eat. The. UNAGI! I got a bone stuck in my throat after eating one. Their idea to get the bone out was to swallow a mouthful of dry rice, which as you may surmise, does not go down well. After leaving, I later had to have it removed at the emergency room! Nice trip, huh?

So I called them later to ask for help with the medical bills and no one who could actually make a decision was on the premises. They still won't call me back.

Spread the word - don't eat here. If there's anything wrong with the food, you're on your own for dealing with it. And most certainly never ever eat their Unagi!!!
author: Tommy L.

description: This is across the street from work so when I've got a need to fulfill a Japanese food craving and feeling a little less motivated to trekking somewhere for lunch, this is my joint. They've got a full sushi bar, bento options, and entrees. Two-item bentos start at $8.50 and three item at at $10.50. It's not mind-blowing Japanese food but the portions are just right and it hits the spot without having to go too far.
author: Anna R.

description:
Maru is a nice neighborhood sushi place. I've actually never eaten inside, but have received take out a number of times. 

The food is good, not amazing, but the fish is definitely fresh. When ordering for takeout, the food is always ready within 15-20 minutes. 

The ambience, from what I've seen, is definitely better than neighboring sushi places. But if you're only ordering take-out, go to Sushi Toni (less than a block away) - the food and selection of rolls is much better.
author: Cristina P.

description: I was pretty impressed with this place. Service was prompt, servers were friendly, and the food was great! I've been to several sushi places around town, and I was reluctant to go here due to the 3 star reviews, but I am glad we went! The fish was very fresh, we got the Dragon Roll and the Romeo and Juliet Roll - both packed with flavor. I ended up getting the Miso Clam Soup, really good, perfect flavor, and I loved the twist with the added clams. We also got a Mixed Tempura to share as an appetizer, it came with 2 shrimp, and mixed veggies - deep fried to crispy perfection. I'm so glad my friend prompted us to go when our other plans didn't work out. I live in the neighborhood and can definitely see this becoming a favorite! Will definitely be back.
author: Anna D.
