description: Went here with low expectations because we needed to eat a quick meal not too far from the theater we were headed to, so we had limited choices & randomly went here.  WAY exceeded my expectations -- both the tempura veggie roll and the Kuwai roll (another veg roll that had asparagus, mango, avocado) were delicious.  The miso soup was good, too.  Service was attentive and friendly.  I would definitely go back.
author: Molly P.

description: Sushi selection is good but the soba noodles were wanting. Location is not bad as it is just a few blocks away from Union Square. On the whole the experience is a bit above average.
author: Naresh T.

description:
Sushi: below average
Service:  below average.  Took 55 minutes to make 5 rolls when there was 6 people inside.  That's 11 minutes a roll.  I can do it faster than that!  Mind you it would be horrendous :)

Conclusion:  go to Sushi Toni around the block on bush.  Go up to bush and take a left!  Much better sushi, service and much cheaper and faster
author: Tony N.

description: We found this place just walking by looking for a hotel nearby. It was lunch time. The place was occupied by local Asian diners, both Chinese and Japanese, which is always a good sign. The food was very good, reasonably priced and the service was fast and accurate, but the décor needed some improvement. The menu covered a good variety of Japanese dishes as well as a few Asian dishes. Good place for a family, or a date.
author: Bariatric Runner X.

description: The BOMB....highly recommend the Godzilla and crunch roll along with a veggie roll of your choice
author: Kam F.

description: I returned while in the City for a conference.  Another fabulous experience at the sushi bar.
author: Jackson G.

description: We are in town for a couple of days and walked over to Maru Sushi from the Mark. Food was awesome, ambience so so, service fine but uninspired. Lots of locals. If you're about the sushi, you'll love it.
author: Anne H.

description:
I have not been to San Francisco before but really wanted to try everything. I was told that Maru sushi right up the street from UNion Square was very good. Now keeping in mind that there are millions of places to eat in San Fran but it was a good stop. It was not crowded. and we were attended to immediately. 

The food was good and so was the service. I think the menu could be a little better. ONly becuase on the Sake i really did not know much about so it was hard to pick one. 

But good palce to eat.
author: Brett A.

description: I was attending a review class in the city one weekend and only had an hour for lunch.  I decided to try this place since it was just right across the street.  The food was flavorful and the portion wasn't bad either.  For a very reasonable price, I was pleasantly satisfied. The only downside is the service - it's slow  even when no one is inside.
author: Deana M.

description: Standard sushi joint.  Had the Ocean roll, 49ers roll, katsu donburi + a bento box.  The ocean roll was my favorite part of the meal.  49ers roll was weird - had super sour tangerine/orange or whatever on top.  Katsu donburi was good; rice was a little soupy, but it tasted good like that.  Bf liked his bento box.  Service was quick + attentive.  One of the few sushi places that were actually opened on a Sunday afternoon!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
The service is getting slower and slower each time!  I'm so disappointed!  The servers are super nice but take forever!  

=(
author: Robert M.

description:
When we walked in, we were not greeted right away because they were very busy.  We basically had to ask if we could sit at the sushi bar.  I'm used to being offered that-not ignored just because there are no tables available.  

They didn't even give us any menus.  After sitting a while, the oh so nice Sara W. got up and gave us the to go menus.  My bf and I ordered sushi rolls.  I have to say, I don't know if it was because I was sitting watching the sushi chef make all the rolls, or if it's because it really did take a long time.  It felt like he did 15 other orders before he got to ours.  And as soon as he started ours, he didn't even finish it.  He prob did 2 at a time, and I think we ordered 7 rolls total.  But my bf, and our friends were nice enough to wait for me.  

If it wasn't for the freshness of the sushi, I prob would've given the place 2 stars.  But wow, I can't deny how fresh the sushi was.  It would melt in my mouth!  

It also felt like it took forever for our check to arrive.  We ended up going to the front and personally asking for it.  The guy up front didn't even look at us because he thought we were waiting for a seat.  Until I asked him for the check-that is when he paid attention to us and became nice.  Their sushi really saved them from a worse review!
author: S U.

description: Standard sushi, semi-pricey but super cool ambiance. Great drinks thus a go-to spot with my best friend when we're both home!
author: Mairead J.

description: I came here a few times since it was a couple blocks from where I lived but don't expect anything too authentic. Service was usually pretty friendly.
author: Suz L.

description:
WAY BETTER than Sushi House in Alameda, CA.  (Last time I went to Sushi House, the fish quality was really bad.  At the same time, I think that place has gone down hill because all of their rolls are just laiden with mayo and other sauces.  Can't even taste the fish.  Well, with their quality, you don't want to taste the fish!)

Had the Firecracker (or Fireworks?) roll (Had cooked salmon in it and man, that was the right type of spice.), Spider roll (Best one I've had so far.  Has soft shell crab.  YUM!), toro, and some other roll which I cannot remember (I think it was spicy tuna).  My friend and I agreed that all the rolls tasted fresh and had a good ratio of rice, cucumber, and fish.  

As for service.  My friend and I were at the bar but everyone was friendly, especially the sushi chefs.

For a place in the middle of Union Square ... Where it could possibly go to a sad touristy graveyard ... This place rocks!!!!!

As for the price...

Toro:  $12 for 2 pieces
Friend had tea.  I had 1 Coca-Cola.
3 rolls ranged from $7 to $9 

Total was $41.88.  WELL WORTH IT.
author: Cat S.

description: Eh, so not worth going back to. It served it's purpose of feeding two very hungry people, but the sushi was just okay. The place is warm, like be sure to go in shorts and a tank top, warm. The food came really quickly, but that just made you wonder why it came so quickly. Food should take a little time to prepare, at the very least. The udon was bland. The tempura was not crisp, like it was sitting out for a while and they just tossed it in the oven to warm the outside. The Philedelphia roll slices were cut too big. The chicken teriyaki was the smallest portion I have ever seen. I was not impressed.
author: Christina P.

description: I had a crunch roll and a potato-bug roll. Both were very tasty. The service was fine, the two ladies very pleasant. Yes, the washrooms (well, the men's, anyway) desperately need cleaning!
author: Doug C.

description:
Dumb luck find.  Rode a cable car, saw it, figured wtf, let's try it.

Overall, it is sushi but if you are a picky newbie to sushi (the dude next to me as I ate), the chef will accommodate.

There are a lot of random reviews, but my experience was fine.  Service was average, the food was fresh (had to wait for sushi which is what I expect for a freshly prepared roll) and the quality was good. Is this a cutting edge high nose in the air snob sushi house?  No.  

Is it a great place for a roll, yes.

We didn't try anything else there with the exception of sushi and pot stickers but i would go back.
author: Cole X.

description:
Really liked this place.  Had the Cupid roll, so it was cooked salmon, asparagus, really tasty, not greasy at all. Had the miso with mushrooms, smooth if not a little salty. The seaweed salad was fresh and brown rice perfectly cooked.  

Waitress was very attentive, no problem on tea refills and ensuring I had what I needed. All staff were speaking English quite clearly ( earlier reviews indicate language barrier ), and in fact no yelling back and forth in their mother tongue that you find in china town restos. 

I give it a 3.5 only because it is a little overpriced, but yum.
author: Pebble L.

description: I have never been to Japan and had sushi.  But I have eaten many varieties and a lot of it at various places in the states.   From that experience, I understand the fish should be cold, not warm,  and rolls should adhere well and not crumble apart.  But the two snobby "experts" beside me at the sushi bar, who came in after me, enjoyed immediate attention, which I did not, and we're served immediately seemed to like the place.  Perhaps it was the busy extremely busy restaurant being attended by just two servers, or the men next to me who constantly demanded attention, but service wasn't great either.
author: Tom M.

description: We enjoyed our bento box lunch specials here. The chicken teriyaki was very moist and flavorful, and the California roll was comparable to other places. The portions all were pretty good (no shortage of steamed rice, either), and the server was pleasant enough. The decor is tasteful and the atmosphere is comfortable, too.
author: Anthony P.

description:
This is my regualr Sushi place, quality fish and great location. 

Trick to any sushi place is to sit at the bar - right in front of chef. Place the order directly - that way you make sure rolls come fresh - on table there is always a chance that sushi sits after being prepared by chef before it is delivered to you.

Chefs at the Budha & Danni are pretty cool guys, friendly and attentive.
All in all - best sushi place in Union Sq area.
author: Sean S.

description: I used to dine at this establishment when it was previously Tempura House.  It's NOT the same restaurant when it comes to the service.  My dining companion and I ended up leaving due to the poor service and lack of.  Right when we walked in, it was a red flag.  There were three servers with multiple tables available and we were kept waiting to be seated.  It took a good 10 minutes before a server took our order, THEN when we FINALLY got our orders, BOTH were wrong.  We ended up leaving before they could correct it, we were so fed up.  Observing while waiting for our meals the first time around, I saw that another table was getting multiple requests corrected.  I say skip this place and go elsewhere!
author: Kim L.

description: Coming from Hawaii, this restaurant provides us with a reliable taste of home.  Full complement of sushi, udon, soba and I just had the best spicy chicken yakitori appetizer that went perfectly with my husbands beef udon.  And....the price is right!
author: Katy A.

description:
You can tell a lot about a place by the way they serve and prepare their hamachi, this establishment isn't fantastic; but it certainly fairs better than others in the city. 

The atmosphere is traditional, seating capacity is well thought out, and the chefs are friendly, but not exactly the type to do shots with you; so if you're looking for some excitment, then re-think going here. 

What you will find here is well prepared food, a moderately priced menu, a wide selection and you're still a block from union square; which makes up for anything this place might have been lacking.

Location: 5 stars
Atmosphere: 4 stars
Menu selection: 3.5 stars
Price: 2 stars
Last impression: 3.5 stars
author: J Q.

description: A friend and I were really hungry and were looking for things to eat around Union Square that weren't a) extremely fancy or b) fast food.  We happened upon Maru Sushi.  Nothing special nor anything to complain about here.  It's the type of standard sushi place that emphasizes rolls over actual sushi/sashimi.. you'll like it if you like rolls.  My friend liked the lion king, and my 49er roll was decent.
author: Katherine L.

description: I am in love with this place. I have been going there for 2 years. I think they have the best green salad and dragon rolls. service is nice but not the best.
author: Hilal P.

description:
I used to come to this place all the time during my lunch breaks because I worked downtown. I loved it because it was the closest sushi place, for a decent price. My friend would order the veggie tempura with shrimp, I'd always go for the nigiri, and never had any issues with the food taking long or tasting odd.
The only thing I had issues with was the service. Although the servers are pretty nice, they took a long time to get our check so we could pay and get back to work on time. It ended up turning into a game, where my friend and I would stare at the waitress and give her the look (the "please come over and tend to me because I'm looking straight at you"  look). I mean, nothing special, but I've seen sketchier sushi bars.
author: Alyssa G.

description: I was worried about this place because of the reviews, but we were desperate and hungry and ended up here.  I thought the service was great, the sushi was great, too.  We had two that had crunchy bits that were killer. The Justin Roll was my favorite. Good location and I would definitely eat there again.
author: Robin R.

description: We were wandering around Union Square when we got hungry and on the way to Lori's Diner, we decided to try this sushi spot. The place was full at 7:00 p.m. on a Saturday night, but not crazy. We got a seat right away at the bar, and when a server didn't bring menus after a while, I picked some to-go ones up at the front. Soon after, the waitress got our orders, and I got mine first not long after that. I ordered donburi, and I was happy because while there were no vegetarian donburi items on the menu (the meat ones they had were about $15!), the waitress said I could get one with just vegetables. The BF and our two friends ordered rolls, and while they were very fresh and tasty, they came out very staggered, with a couple first and the last two a good 15 minutes after. Overall, I was happy with this place!
author: Sara W.

description:
We stopped in while walking down Powell for a roll or two and we were pleasantly surprised!  We both got 1 roll and both rolls were very good.  The bathroom was gross....but if you never entered the bathroom..you'd think this was a very nice place!

Good food, good service.  I'd return...but probably not for a full sushi dinner.
author: Katie B.

description:
I am very disheartened that I have to take time out of a busy day to write this review.

This used to be my "neighborhood place", I've been going for about a year a few times a month.  I usually went for lunch on weekends, as the prices for the same amount of food are a lot cheaper at lunchtime.

However, after the way I was treated there last night, I will NEVER eat at Maru Sushi again.

I was having a late dinner with my boyfriend.  We ordered salad, tempura, vegetarian rolls of various sorts, and miso soup.  The miso soup was cold - not just tepid, but cold.  But the real problem was the sake.  We ordered a bottle of hot sake to split.  When I was almost finished with my second glass, I noticed a small insect in the glass.

I understand that restaurants, just like homes, sometimes get insects.  This is the second time I have eaten there and gotten an insect in my sake.  I have to wonder where they keep the sake jugs and glasses - I'm sure the health department would be just as interested.

The first time this happened, our meal was free and we received a personal apology.  I believe it was still the Tempura House then.

I could not believe this had happened a second time.  I immediately brought it to the server's attention and asked for our food to go.  She did not offer to replace it, or to remove it or credit our bill.  She simply took the glass away and proceeded to spend 5 minutes busing tables, and ignored our request for food to go.

I am not quick to anger, particularly given that this is one of my most visited and convenient places.  I brought the fact that our requests were being ignored to the sushi chef's attention.  The server was still busing tables and would not make eye contact with me.

There were by that time no other customers in the restaurant.  They made no offer to credit or even provide us with the bill.  They did not apologize or try to fix the situation in any manner. 

It is my opinion that a sushi restaurant that cannot keep bugs out of the sake jars probably has more problems than just that.  I didn't see what their inspection rating was because the certificate was not visible.  Although I will not be returning there, this is serious enough that I believe the health department should be notified.  This is a busy restaurant that is usually packed with both tourists and locals.  

I have to wonder how many others got a side of insect with their sake.  It felt to me like lightning striking twice.  I am a believer in second and even third chances, but this is inexcusable.

Dear Maru Sushi: you have lost a good customer.  Even though your food is overpriced and your service completely lackluster, I always tipped at least 15% and I enjoyed the majority of my experiences with you.  I feel both personally slighted at the way I was treated upon the second bug incident and disappointed that any business would treat a customer as discourteously as you treated me.

Dear Yelpers: If you'd like overpriced average sushi prepared in what I strongly suspect is an unclean kitchen with insect infestation, this is your place.  I am now taking applications for a new sushi restaurant in the lower Nob Hill area, so message me if you know of a good one where I won't find a bug in my sake.
author: Jillian W.

description: Great spot for a quick and yummy bento box and sushi.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: My husband and I are not from San Francisco, we were searching around for a sushi place, that also offered a cooked food option. We used yelp to find a couple of places. We were walking from Washington park. We were staying on post street. We came across Maru Sushi, we really enjoyed the time and effort it seemed that they put onto the place. It was very nice and clean. As far as the food, the sushi was wonderful along with the chicken teriyaki. As far as the bad service reviews, if you go on a really busy night, I could see that. But we were there on a Wednesday night with little hassle as far as service.  I definitely think this is a place to check out here.
author: Ashley B.

description:
I used to like this place, then, I kept getting expired red sashimi. 

I can tell it is going bad when it gets a gummy waxy look. I got the runs(waterey sheit) and havent been back ever since.

Last visit, bout 2 years.
author: Keit K.

description:
I cannot blame Maru Sushi for opening up a sushi restaurant in America, brandishing its psuedu athentic Japanese sushi flair..Americans can and will, sadly, not understand real good sushi.

My mother and I (both immigrants from Japan) went here for a taste test because we had to order sushi for a New Year's Eve Party. I asked my mom why she chose this restaurant, replying that this American man who works at the same building recommended this restaurant.

I knew in that instant that I was on the road to an upset stomach and appetite. 

The decour was EXTREMELY TACKY, UNAUTHENTIC, AND the workers behind the sushi bar were not only not Japanese, but had the worst "IRASHAIMASE" accent ever...please, don't even try to pronounce it because my mom and I started to laugh. Sushi is bland, portions too big, and MISO soup was in this oval shaped bowl with a SPOON. The restaurant is also owned by Koreans..very authentic.

People, I am sorry to burst your bubble but "dragon rolls", "california rolls" and all of these other "rolls" you people invent IS NOT SUSHI. You will NEVER find this in Japan..

All in all, my mother and I had the company pay for our over-priced and over-hyped dinner. 

Then we went home for some GOOD, AUTHENTIC japanese cooking.
author: jessica s.

description:
Portions are pretty small. I mean miso soup in Japanese resturants has got to be made in bulk. A half bowl to start foreshawdowed the rest of the meal. 

Service and ambience was okay (cute random xmas lights everywhere), the waitresses are emotionless--its passing but you can def. find better in a place like San Francisco.
author: Amy S.

description:
Fresh fish, great location, decent if not slightly expensive prices, and friendly sushi chef's.  

Their Live Scallop presentation is absolutely, melt-in-your-mouth goodness... and nothing like anything I've ever tasted.  It's pricey but absolutely divine and worth the splurge.

Now that I have Maru on the brain, all I can think about is this:

http://prometheus.med.utah.edu/~bwjones/C741542647/E20070417140221/Media/Sushi%20good.jpg 

(withouot the questionable & creepy dude hiding behind my make-believe lunch...)
author: Whitney H.

description: The food is fantastic--the quality of the sushi and sashimi is great. Definitely coming here again.
author: Samantha T.

description: Good California rolls, not the best, I've had better from Trader Joe's, believe it or not.  Either way, this was cute little place, good service, nice location.  P.S., I don't even eat real sushi, the rolls are as far as I go.  So, just know that if you're friends want to get sushi, there will be something here for you too, because they have a more tame menu as well for us more conventional diners.
author: Mike K.

description: Not bad for sushi. Got mainly vegetarian rolls and I have to say their use of spinach is different but delicious. Try the Popeye roll!
author: Julia E.

description: Grabbed lunch with a couple of friends in this place and had a positive experience. It's pretty isolated in comparison to most restaurants around this area (because it is usually full of tourists and shoppers), but it was a nice and quiet place to eat in. There was only one waiter who served us at the time, but we still had good service. I believe we ordered a spider roll,one order of shrimp nigiri,  a sprite, and  two bento boxes (which comes with your choice of sushi rolls, rice, salad, and miso soup). All totaled up to around 40 bucks, which wasn't so bad in my opinion. I would come to this place again.
author: Clementine D.

description: Food was good for the price. Would have been 4 stars but we found a dead bug in the soy sauce, but hey a little  extra protein never hurt nobody right? Oh yeAh, our server seemed miserable
author: Javi G.

description: This place is not for sushi snobs! Only had the sushi. I would say it was average at best. Didnt seem very fresh- fish warm and limp. Service poor and slow. Forgot part of our order and never realized (although charged on bill).  Would look for other options.
author: Detrick r.

description: Sushi is one of the only things I can have every night of the week. I went to Maru sushi after trying Sushi Rika a block away the night before. A bit more expensive than Rika and no real difference in the quality of fish. I had the Crazy Roll (Tuna, Yellowtail and Salmon with Avocado) and the Sake Nigiri. It was a comfortable and rather mellow atmosphere but not sure I would go back.
author: Debbie C.

description:
The dragon rolls were really good.  The beef teriyaki tasted weird.  Kinda like raw meat.  It wasn't raw though, but yuck.  The spicy tuna roll was yummy too.  

The bathroom was not clean, there was water all over the floor.  Just gross.  

I didn't pay for the meal, so I'm not sure how much it came too.
author: Heather W.

description:
At 11 bucks for a three item Bento Box, which comes with salad and Miso soup, it's hard to go wrong.

I had chicken teriyaki, tempura and a spicy tuna roll and it was all fresh and tasty. 

Nothing that stood out as fantastic, but definitely did the job and since it's one of the closest restaurants to Rug Jones, I will definitely be back.
author: Jason R.

description:
Had the 2 item bento for lunch.
I selected yakiniku & tempura. Wakame.

The Wakame Salad was pretty good. It was the best part of lunch.

Miso soup lacked in flavor and... the miso soup came with a spoon, a clear indication of things to come.

Tempura was ok, I noticed only the shrimp was breaded in panko.
Yakiniku lacked in flavor, there was very little beef, mostly vegetables.

Probably not coming back.
author: Geordie E.

description:
This is decent enough. Decent enough for those wednesday nights when you are exhausted and just want some decent sushi so you're appetite can be decently satisfied. You can then get a decent nights sleep so you can get a decent amount of work done the next day.

like i said, its decent.
author: Erin F.

description:
The last few times I've been here, the service has been really, really slow. And I've been here during lunch peaks and slow periods. Either the food would take a really long time or the check would come to the table 15 or 20 minutes after we've finished eating. And it's never consistently been the same thing either. It would be one or the other (occasionally both).

One time they kept forgetting to bring tea after we'd asked repeatedly. Another time they didn't bring a salad for an item that the menu said came with a salad. I was so sure it would take forever coming out, I didn't bother mentioning it to the server.

They only ever seem to have two or three people working here at a time, and it honestly feels like they just have one server, and anyone else walking around is a food runner or a hostess.

I guess I really like that 3 item lunch bento, because I keep coming here despite the consistently slow service. The katsu curry is pretty good, and the chirashi is ~$13 and pretty filling.

Dinner is pretty pricey, so I would just recommend lunch.
author: Trish B.

description: This is hands down my favorite sushi place in the whole world.  I come here once a year when I'm in town for a convention and it is always outstanding.  Best specialty rolls on earth!  The family affair roll is the best!
author: Brian G.

description:
Update: went back and actually had sushi this time.  Some nigiri, some rolls, and it ranged from ok to good.  It also wasn't quite as expensive as I remembered; maybe they changed their menu?

I live two blocks from here, and used to come sometimes when it was still Tempura House.  I went there tonight and ordered 2-item combo with beef teryaki and california roll.  I was going to get some nigiri too, but after tasting the miso and teriyaki I decided not too.  The teriyaki sauce was awful and the beef was overcooked.  The staff were nice though, pretty fast too..  But $17 for that meal was bullshit.  I won't be coming back.
author: Joseph N.

description: Bad service overpriced did not even get my miso soup while i paid. A bad experience and they do not know how to do sashimis
author: Clement B.

description: We have eaten here for nearly a decade ...but the original owner of the sushi house sold the business to a new owner and now the quality of the food and price has become increasingly unpalatable. Imagine $15 for katsu curry (basically tonkatsu or breaded pork with japanese curry over rice) with 4 pcs. of katsu and bland curry (with just bits of potatoes). Talk about over priced menu. We all know that the prices of food has been rising but this is simply ridiculous. Sure the decor is pretty authentic japanese restaurant but the food certainly isn't.
author: Fabled O.

description: I passed by this restaurant around 6pm on Sunday night and decided to give it a try.  The sushi was surprisingly fresh.  I ordered a Hamachi and a Saba nigiri.  Both were really good.  Also ordered the Rainbow Roll and a deep fried softshell crab.  Surprised as everything was good.  Prices are a little high, but at least you know the fish will be fresh.
author: LoveYelp L.

description: Disappointed, definitely not serving Japanese food. And I'm still hungry after had dinner there. Is there any Japanese operated Japanese resturant in SF?
author: Lei W.

description:
Why I frequent Maru: 
1.) Yummy rolls - love their spicy tuna and california roll, ooh, and their red devil roll (a special I believe).  
2.) Good prices.  Not THE cheapest around, but still pretty inexpensive.  
3.) Close to my apartment.  

Basically, Maru is a solid sushi place.  No frills and sort of a silly interior (a little cheesy), but when I am in the mood for a few rolls for lunch or dinner, Maru always hits the spot.
author: Lauren H.

description:
It was 6pm on a weekday when I walked in and found the place completely empty. No customers. Just staff. It's moments like these when I want to turn and run, but I'm too much of a wuss to do it. I'm glad I didn't. 

As I started my miso soup the place began to fill up with other brave customers. While I can tolerate and sometimes enjoy sushi, I'm not a huge fan - so I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki. It was good - a huge portion too. They must have given me the entire chicken. I didn't finish it, maybe because of the sumo-sized chicken, or maybe I was just saving room for the Fried Tempura Ice Cream. Who doesn't love fried goodness? I've never seen a dessert item like this on a menu before, but since I'm a little ignorant to Japanese cuisine I don't know if this is traditional or a novelty. They had some interesting flavors like red bean, green tea and mango. I decided to keep it safe and went with the mango. It was really good. Again, the portions are out of control. A single scoop would have been more than enough - instead of 4 softball-sized tempura balls.
author: Preston R.

description:
One Sunday evening, my bestest girlfriends and myself decided to have Sunday supper in the city! And what better way to have Sunday supper than to feast on sushi! Thank goodness for friends who love sushi as much as I do!

We began the night with a round of green tea (since the winter weather outside had given a couple of us the sniffles) and a bowl of edamame. We managed to finish 3 bowls of edamame by the end of the night...we eat that stuff like a fat kid eats cake...except its healthier!!

Anyways, we each ordered a roll (there were 5 of us) I ordered the Cherry Blossom roll and it was delicious! One of my friends ordered one of the special sushi rolls off of the board and another ordered the Kappa Roll...I'm unsure of the other rolls, but they were delicious. 

Along with the rolls, we ordered salmon sashimi! Delicious!

Good place - right near Union Square - so if you're tired from shopping, walk up Powell and get yourself a table at Maru! Our bill was very reasonable and we were pleasantly stuffed!

Cheers!
author: Jackie D.

description:
I've used Yelp for a long time now to find great restaurants and avoid bad ones.  This is the first time I've been driven to write one though.  I don't want anyone to make the same mistake I did.  

San Francisco is full of great Sushi places, Maru Sushi is not one of them.  Avoid at all costs.

The service was remarkably bad.  It took a long time to get a full set of drinks and chopsticks for everyone at the table and once the food came, one person's order was completely forgotten.  

Food was middle of the road: A good selection of rolls.  I was happy with my rainbow roll and tempura but the Oh Yes! roll wasn't as wonderful.  One of the rolls must have been bad as I woke up with severe stomach pains and spent half my night in the bathroom.  At least one other person in our group had a similar reaction.  I know this is the risk you take with sushi, but I have a pretty tough stomach so I was really taken off guard.  

Do yourself a favor and skip Maru Sushi.  You've been warned.
author: Sean L.

description: I was very pleased with the maguro, spicy tuna roll and hamachi.  Can not comment on the rest.
author: Marc T.

description: Maru satisfied my need for food (preferably sushi) while walking back to my hotel from the top of Powell.  For a Tuesday night with amazing weather, you'd think they'd be busier then 5 tables, but hey, I didn't complain because the service was good.  I sat at the bar and was tended to promptly by both the waitress and sushi chef.  The woman I sat next to recommended the La Bamba roll on her way out the door, so that was on my list.  It was a delicious and unique combination of shrimp tempura, tomato, cilantro, jalapeño, topped with spicy crab and avocado.  I've had plenty of specialty chef rolls over the years and this was a top 10 finish.  There was a unique taste in the cilantro with the spicy crab that I'll remember.  You just don't see cilantro in sushi very often, if ever.  I also had a could pieces of tuna nigiri that were VERY fresh and amazingly tasty.  Lastly, I had a standard spicy tuna roll which was a bit mushy, but still edible.  As others have mentioned, you can probably find better options, but Maru is convenient to many large hotels and not a long walk for convention-ers.
author: Ryan P.

description:
The Lunch bento box is only $8.50 for 2 items plus miso and salad. Sadly it's only worth about $5.00. The place was empty, which should have been a clue to what was coming. Overall, the food was bland and artless. The sushi was not what I would call tasty. I always enjoy veggie rolls, but this one had funky pickled veggies that left a questionable after taste in your mouth when paired with tofu and avocado.

The Soda was flat and if you order anything with dressing or a sauce beware, it will come out drenched. No need to go back to this place there are many superior options.
author: Theresa T.

description: So I've eaten here twice and the second time the food was even better than the last time.  The service also improved. Its about a 4 but the quality of the food makes up for it. The fish is really fresh and the rolls are tasty. If you have the chance, you should ask for the hamachi kama. My gf is japanese and she vouches for the place and she knows her stuff. Prices are typical for downtown so I'm ok w that.
author: Larry T.

description: I had lunch several times here. Each time, I seem to order their curry rice dish with oshinko (pickle) as side dish. Of course I like miso soup and green tea when I have Japanese food. It is very convenient location to visit when you are around Union Square for shopping. I must say that I was very satisfied with each visit.
author: Annie K.

description:
I was drinking some haterade when I reviewed Maru last time. Mainly, I would like to apologize for hating on the main sushi chef before. My boyfriend and I went back to Maru tonight and he truly showed us a great evening. 

The chirashi and Kappa roll (the cucumber one with sashimi) were more elegantly presented then any sushi restaurant that I've been to so far in the city. He was attentive, chatted with us and remembered us from before - including his skill, all qualities of a true sushi chef.
author: Eli B.

description: I like their lunch boxes. Their fish has been fresh. Also, Yakiniku is good. I don't know how busy it is for dinner but for lunch it wasn't bad, maybe 45 minutes to order and finish the bento.
author: Cortland T.

description: This is a good place Japanese restaurant. Nothing special, and nothing is missing, just plain authentic.  Fairly priced. If you go there, you should try their Saba (Japanese Mackerel).
author: Yann L.

description: I couldn't be more pleased.  The chirashi was great.  I also got the hiyayako - filling an delicious.  The service as great.  I'd come back.
author: Jaime O.

description:
My wife and I stayed around the corner from this place on a recent trip from Chicago. I must say that I really enjoyed both the food and the decor. Yes its overly dramatic in its attempt at creating a Japanese atmosphere but I felt very comfortable. It did not seem like a tourist style theme restaurant.

The selection was fairly large and did contain many specialty rolls. Maybe I won't find rolls in Japan but I like them, as do many other, and these were very well prepared, fresh, and tasty. Nothing was overpowering. The staff was friendly and the price was reasonable. Maybe its not the best sushil available but it was pretty darn good.
author: John S.

description:
Got the lunch bento box.  It comes with miso, rice, salad; and I ordered the saba shioyaki and the california roll.  Okay, the saba was way overcooked, tough, and a bad cut of the fish.  Not fresh tasting at all.  The calfornia roll was okay.  The miso wasn't very good.

Mostly people who work close by dine here for lunch, it seems.  The restaurant interior was kinda dingy, and it smelled kinda musty inside.  I doubt I'll be back.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I used to order the chicken teriyaki dinner, but no more.

First of all it's way overpriced... (Almost $15) and all you get is a small soup and a salad.

Second of all the chicken is kind of bland.

Third: Service is lackluster. 

I guess it's ok for lunch when things are cheaper.

My g/f says the yaki soba is pretty good...
author: Aaron F.

description: I came here a few days ago for lunch. My boyfriend and I ate a total of $45. Food here is a bit expensive but both of us felt like it is worth it because the food was good. Good service even though food took a while because instead of one roll on a plate, they put it all on one large plate. Getting the check took longer than I expected because it seems like there was only one server.  There is a parking structure a block down so parking wouldn't be difficult. I would recommend coming here if you are around in the neighborhood.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
I used to come to this place when it was still Tempura House.  The food was pretty good actually.  Their rolls are tasty and their udons are too.  Some people might think their food are kinda tasteless, but I think it's pretty decent.  

The atmosphere of the restaurant's pretty nice.  And usually, when the guests first enter, the sushi chefs would greet them with some Japanese phrase that I still couldn't capture...  Service is pretty fast and the portion is okay.  

However, the last time I came here, the price was jacked up (I think it's because the transition from Tempura House to Maru Sushi had finally been completed!).  So I dunno, I chose this place because of the price, and now I might just go somewhere else to try something new since the price range is the same anyway...
author: Erik C.

description: First time there....I ordered a roll off the menu that stated it had Albacore Tuna, Fish eggs, Cucumbers and Mayo.....When I got it... it was very spicy... had the menu stated it was spicy, I would have gone with something else. After asking them to take the spicy out, they gave me a plain roll with only the fish and cucumber in it. Very dry. Bad service... no tea refills and no water. You would be better off going hungry. I have to say that the fish was fresh.
author: Vickie K.

description: Delish! Was in town for a business trip and ate here three times. Great for takeout. Very quick.
author: Nancy V.

description: I like the decor and the service. The sushi is good specially the mango roll!
author: Anuardi J.

description: We stopped here because we were in the mood for sushi and my friend had been here before (well, first we went to Scala, but they could not seat us for another 30 min's, so we had this as our back up plan). It turned out to be a great experience. Service was good and the sushi was great! We had an extra nice server who took about 5 pictures of our group and she was so gracious about it - making sure the pic came out good and continually willing to take another! Very economical too. All around a nice experience and I will be back.
author: Silvia Q.

description: ive been to many different sushi restaurants in san francisco and this one is ok. the only real postive thing about the restaurant was the food, and it was just ok. the service was very slow which is interesting because the place was mostly empty, and the prices are a little bit expensive considering the portions and quality of the sushi. i recommend the sashimi. BEST THING: decor and ambiance. WORST THING: price, not really worth it. overall the place was really cute and the service was really nice but a little bit pricy but i guess you have to consider the location of the restaurant.
author: Eliza B.

description: It was O.K.  After finding out that Nihon was closed on Mondays, we found this spot in Union Square.  We arrived around 6pm and there was a few customers there.  We had 2 waitresses, so the service was good.  We ordered the calamari, fried oysters, Hamachi, seaweed salad, fried salmon roll, and shrimp tempura.  Don't order the calamari, you only get 6 rings for $6.  The fried oysters and tempura was ok. Our salmon roll was not bad.  There were more options some kind of expensive but it looked good for example the dragon roll.  The best part of the meal was the Hamachi.  It was seared right and juicy.  It came up to be $48 with beer and tea.  It's cheap, not too busy, and close to Union square, that's Lexxx's Line for today.
author: Alex L.

description: Looking for a Japanese place for sushi, after a bad experience in an expensive japanese restaurant in Los Angeles, we found Maru Sushi, very simple to choose from the menu they have, and the taste, the better.  I recommend this place for great taste and a great price.
author: Leonel A.

description: I love the BAY AREA SCALLOP ROLL. I have had it everywhere I have had sushi and this is the only place that gets it right. The service is ok. The other rolls are good. But I come to this place once every few months just for the roll.  Love it.
author: michael w.

description: Decent sushi and sashimi, nothing I'd go way out of my way for but some tasty, solid choices for reasonable prices.  We sampled the hamachi and salmon sashimi with a starter of edamame and a couple of rolls (california and spicy tuna.)  Both were good, service was quick, and everything was fine.
author: Jaimie M.

description: Good sushi and teriyaki.  Spicy tuna roll is awesome.
author: Jeffrey C.

description: Food and service was great here, including some good recommendations by the staff. Also the house white wine was verry good! We ordered one of the boat menu which was very tasty and then ordered some more rolls and discovered the crunchy roll the was very tasty! Also the Oh Yes roll was tasty. We (the guys) wanted to order the love boat but the wives wouldn't have it ;-)
author: Erik S.

description: Since other yelpers have done a good job discussing this restaurant I won't get into it too much.  Suffers from lack of excitement and lack of creativity or spark.  Restrooms were spotless when we were there, prices fair.  Food very very mainstream.
author: Richard C.

description: Food was good, cheap... and tasty enough.  Service was not so good, and there were flies everywhere.. what can you do? The Bento box was the  deal I went for .. at $8.50 for 2 items, it was served with salad, soup and rice. Quite enough for a good snack post breakfast. Not sure if I would check it out again, seeing a there are so many other sushi places to try out.
author: Ric H.

description: This is an inexpensive, hole in the wall sushi restaurant.  The decor is nothing to write home about (although better than Sushi Toni just around the corner). However, its clean and the staff are friendly.  The sushi is good for the price.  Overall, my experience was good.
author: Mike T.

description: Great quality, wide menu, fantastic decor and a decent price!
author: Saman S.

description: I went there with 5 other people on a Saturday night.  The food was good but the service was extremely slow.  There were two sushi chefs but they needed 3-4.  There were 3 waitresses but needed a couple more.  There were two people waiting for their to-go order and would have left had they not already paid.  I was about to order dessert but did not dare to because I had been there for two hours already.
author: T.  A.

description: Similar to other reviews. Have always noticed this quaint looking little restaurant coming down Powell on the cable cars. It's actually a nice dining room, but the food and the service were only so-so. My daughter and I never received our salads that came with our dishes. The next table seems to be having a problem getting everything they ordered also. It's too bad, because the location and dining room were really great.  Sushi was only average.  Ohh welll!
author: John F.

description: Was thinking about a sandwich from Starbucks and then heading back to the hotel room, but stopped here instead. Good decision! Dynamite roll was tasty, if more baked than I expected. Volcano roll was excellent, nice and spicy. Prices are about what I'd expect for good sushi.
author: Chris L.

description:
not the best sushi, but it really hit the spot after a day of flying and walking up hills.
atmosphere is nice, the staff friendly, and the music delightful--rolling stones followed by al green.  not single songs, but whole albums.
author: Zachary S.

description: I've eaten here twice, both times I got the Rib Eye Teriyaki and it was pretty good. My friend was happy with his sushi, I'll go back if I'm in the neighborhood, just blocks from Union Square.
author: Klik W.

description: I'm not quite the sushi connoisseur so I can't give the most experienced review on the sushi here. I tend to order the bento boxes or some sort of terriyaki meat dish. So for me the food was pretty good. The service however was poor and will unfortunately keep me from returning. On a positive note, they take American Express. Which is good since they wouldn't have gotten paid any other way today.
author: Heather L.

description: Bad service. They were out of 3 of the things we tried to order. Good rolls, though.
author: Ryan L.

description: I very much enjoyed my experience here the other night....The live scallop and Saba were excellent and the cold sake was perfection! I will most definitely be back!
author: Lara D.

description: Good sushi for a reasonable price. Service was excellent, very friendly staff. Had ikura, tako, toro & maguro.
author: Richard M.

description: Our visit was great.  Nice, friendly service.  Good Sushi at reasonable prices.  We'll go back.
author: D A.

description: A friend recommend we go for sushi down at sushi maru.  And to tell you the truth it has not let me down since.  Sure there are "nicer" places for sushi in the city but when you want a nice quiet evening and you live downtown there are not a lot of choices that aren't crawling with tourists.  Consistanly good/fresh sushi, decent service, big comfy chairs and clean bathrooms. Pretty much covers all the bases for me.
author: Mother L.

description: I've been here a few times for dinner and thought the food was ok...the rolls were decent but portion wasn't very big.  Last night we went for dinner and the service was average...since this is pretty much the other semi decent Japanese restaurant in downtown I think I'll probably go back there again...
author: JenJen W.

description: Great basic Japanese restaurant, the tempura was prepared just like in Japan, and very reasonably priced.  I also had some sushi (Hamachi), and the pieces were generous.  Service is great, the staff is very attentive, polite, and professional.
author: Glenn H.

description: My husband and I ordered 2 miso soups, a crunch roll, 49-er roll, and the volcano and we LOVED IT!!
author: J and L V.

description:
To the owner:

If you want to have a restaurant whereby your customers come back then please have a better trained staff. First, the food is ok, but the staff needs training.  Why are the three staff members talking in a corner and not serving the customer; get one of those call buttons on each table so we do not need to get up and find help.   When a customer asks for a dish or plate say "yes madam" or "yes sir" but not "you do not need a plate".  And why does it take three staff members 5 minutes to calculate the bill.  Sorry, but the three persons and the light bulb theory does not work in the restaurant business.  So, please have your staff go to Math.com for a quick review on addition and percentage.
author: jon f.

description: Food was mediocre: spicy tuna roll was meh, toro sashimi was ok, but the shredded daikon(?) garnish and the rice were both dried out.  That would have earned them a 2 or 2.5-star rating.  But then the bill came: $27 for 1 order of toro sashimi???  Are you serious???  It was on their specials board, with no price listed.  The sushi chef just said "Didn't you know?"  No, I didn't know - how was I supposed to know when you didn't say anything when I placed my order and there's no price on the board?  He said "Have you had toro before?"  Yes, but not here, and I sure as #@!! didn't pay $27 for it.  Well, it was already eaten, and we were late for the theatre so we paid, but we won't be back, that's for sure.
author: J T.

description: Service ambiance and presentation are good but the miso soup and dragon roll I had were among the least tasteful I've had in my life. The food filled my tummy but didn't satisfy my palate.
author: M M.

description:
when I'm downtown i try and stop here every time. 
sushi is always good 
not on the menu but the tuna tataki is amazing! 
play the Beatles how could i not love it!
author: Devin B.

description: Sushi is in my top five favorite foods.  After a long day at work, a friend and I were craving sushi.  We decided to try Maru sushi in San Fran.  We parked across the street in the garage and came in for dinner.  We were seated and the waitress made us wait for a really long time before we could place our orders.  The food arrived with the sushi first and then the pot stickers came later.  I was not very happy with the service.  The waitress seemed irritated when my friend asked for the sushi to be prepared without avocado.  Granted, its an interesting request but  simple request.  She kept trying to offer suggestions but they were not the same kind of sushi and were more expensive so it didnt make much sense.  She eventually just put the order in without the avocado but it just seemed to be and odd situation.  There were not many people in the restuarant but she never came back for refills.  The food was ok but nowhere near the best sushi I have had in the city.  I would say that if you were in the area and looking for sushi, you could find better options.
author: Adam B.

description: This place is decent as my friend were actually trying to go to Akiko's sushi down the block but they were closed. This place was the next closest Japanese place and they had a lunch special, with 2 items for $8.50 and 3 for $10.50. There was one lady working as the greeter and waitress so it took a while to get our order though she was nice. Our "Romeo and Juliet" came and it tasted fine, but nothing spectacular. My friend and I both got the bento boxes and it came out like 20 minutes later but hers came first and then mine. Then there was a problem: mine wasn't mine. Apparently the lady gave me some guy's order and he got mine. I called her over after like 5minutes because she was in the kitchen and told her and she quickly switched it over. It bugged me because I waited for a while so if I was a bitch I could have easily picked at the food but I didn't. The guy just got it so I assumed he didn't touch it yet either. The food was alright but my beef Yakinkunu dish was really rubbery or hard to chew, but the sashimi wasn't bad though  The lady was nice, but she gave us our bill twice when the bill was already on the table. It wasn't busy but her mind seemed pre-occupied. I might visit this place later on if I am craving for cheap Japanese food during lunch but otherwise I might go to some other places.
author: Annie T.

description: This is a case of the kids running the school yard. The service here is from the cutsey-off handed school: reaching across you, argung, hurrying you, sloppy and distracted. We ate here once a year or so ago then returned last night to exactly the same service with different waitresses as though they had been "trained" that way. The food is good, a bit above most Japanese restaurants for what they do. And, if you're 19 you may not even mind the vague, high school approach. If you're a little older it will be better to control the service the moment you walk in. Not worth it for the meal and, as far as an experience, there is none. There was an outrageously drunk and load woman at the bar and the fact that they nothing to try and control her is an indication of the level of service at this place. Walk past.
author: TW M.

description: Yuck. So the fiance and I are trying to hit up all these neighborhood joints before we move out of the neighborhood. I wish we wouldn't have wasted one of our meals on this place and just stuck with a pizza from uncle vito's instead. First of all, it was Friday night around 9. The place was pretty much dead. They sat us by the door and left it open the whole time. Yes, it was fairly warm night for the city - but still, 9pm in SF, it was coldie by the door! Close it already, it's not really summer time yet. Then I went to the rest room to wash my hands before dinner - NO SOAP!? What? How can a restaurant have no soap in the bathroom, ever, isn't there laws or something about having to wash your hands, and allow your customers to wash their hands. So, stuck to the hand sanitizer int eh purse, but still was annoyed. Then the waitress was so shy we could barely make out the words she was trying to say to us. We asked about a specific roll another table had ordered, she told us it was some expensive roll of the specials, it looked awesome so we ordred it. What we got was a totally different roll than the table we'd tried to copy. The sushi was only ok, but the service and atmosphere was lame lame lame. Will never go back and this place will definitely help me not miss the neighborhood anymore once we move.
author: Audrey V.

description: tourist trap.  food not that authentic or fresh, i was better off going to subway.  nothing much enjoyable about the place but the service was ok.
author: Jeff W.

description: it's just good... the interior is a joke and it's certainly not for the purist, but it's a solid take out place, especially compared to the other jokes in the neighborhood (sushiman on bush, sushi rock on pine, akira on mason).
author: luda h.
